description:
Best hot pot in the city hands down!!
Quality meats. Quality service. 
All you can eat!

Has a side area with veggies, mushrooms,noodles, seafood items (fish balls, fish cake, clams, mussels) 
Sauces 

Ribeye - superior choice of beef. Great flavor, tender! But not too fatty. 
Wagyu - pretty average and not as good as ribeye
Supreme beef - average beef. I'd say pass 
Lamb - delicious, tender slices of lamb. 
Premium pork
Premium beef

Pork belly - delicious! Has skin on, the only way I like my pork belly 
Fillet of sole - I'd say pass on this one 
House made dumpling / filled with corn and shrimp. Surprisingly tasty

Also all you can eat dessert. 2 choices. Grass jelly vs ice cream. Simple but delicious. Clean end to a feast!
author: J P.

description:
Staff was friendly, only that they informed us they charge extra if we have leftovers when we asked for our bills....you should do that at the beginning....
Food was okay, not so many choices
They've got a few choices of broth but not very authentic :(
author: Amanda L.

description:
LOVVEE this place! When you're freezing your booty off in Inner Sunset, this is the place to go thaw out. They have Yelp Waitlist now too so make sure you put your name down before you head over!

The AYCE meats are super fresh and the quality stays consistent during your whole meal. They have a buffet style area in the back where you can pick up all your veggie, tofu, fishcake, and noodle needs, but all the meat is delivered by the servers. 

The restaurant itself is a really chill joint with TVs and good music. 
Overall a great place, and I would recommend over any other hotpot place in the Sunset.
author: Jenny L.

description: This is my new favorite place for AYCE hot pot.  For $30.99 you get to help yourself with veggies, dipping sauces and fish balls, sausages and prawns etc.  The staff are efficient and super nice.  We ordered our meats and the meal includes a soda drink and a dessert - ice cream or watermelon n sago drink.  What can I say.... the menu is simple and easy to read, the interior is modern .  Lots of TVs on the walls, great for watching sports events with friends. Will definitely be returning.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Actually became one of my favorite ayce hot pot places in SF. For $28, you get a lot of variety and choices of meats to choose from.

Ordering meats and broth is as standard as any other hot pot place. After you order, they have a whole buffet bar for side dishes. Go and choose from various types of seafood, vegetables, noodles, and sauces. It's so cool seeing everything laid out in front of you and you just get to take whatever you like, and however much you like. And even though the place can get crowded sometimes, the staff always replenish the bar whenever something runs out.

The beef is tender and juicy. You can even order wagyu, which is not on the menu (see picture)! Definitely would come back here!
author: Golden H.

description:
Wow, it's been almost two years since I've tried this place when they first opened. It's definitely time for an updated review.

As most of all Yelpers know, the experience of the restaurant doesn't stop at just the food. It's a whole package experience from the approach of the restaurant, the service, the ambiance, the food (of course), the cleanliness, all the way to you step foot out the door. Some thing must have happened during these two years because the staff at Fiery is slamming down their house rules on their customers like you're attending class. I intended to enjoy a relaxing dinner with my family, I wasn't expecting nor prepared for a dining 101 session at the beginning of my meal.

First of all, parking in the area was relatively easy for a Sunday night. Fiery made it super easy to get on the waitlist through Yelp so you can time your arrival to be seated promptly. Got 3 adults, 1 child, and 1 toddler in my party (toddler under 3, free). Because of our party of 5 (toddlers are people too), they pushed a 2 seater table together with a 4 seater for our party. Waiter comes over to take our order, specifically asked for the kids age and then as if I could hear the class bell rings, class is in session.

Rule #1: You only have 3 adults and 1 child, toddler eats free. We can only give you ONE pot. You don't meet the minimum requirement to get 2 pots, extra pot will cost you an additional price of an adult ($20+).

Rule #2: Your dining session is timed at 90 minutes, it began as you get seated. (We nodded, but he repeated a few more times as if nodding is not the universal gesture for understanding)

Rule #3: We will charge you for any excess leftover food as we shall deemed appropriate. (He tried to repeated it a couple more times, but by now he can tell we're annoyed so he didn't attempt to remind us for the 3rd time)

Rule #2 and #3 is very typical in most other hot pot places, it's normally written on the menus, not thrown in your face a few times to make sure you're aware of it. I think we were just minutes away of them bringing over a written consensus form for us to sign to make sure we understood their rules. Rule #1 was a strange one too me. They formed a 2 table seating situation for us with two burners available. Throughout the whole dinner, that one burner was unused. What if I were to ask for an empty pot and get soup in there as they offer us refill soup? How much more trouble would it had been to just give us the pot of broth in the first place? AND, nowhere was there any information you must meet a certain party size to obtain a # of soup pots.

The whole no this, no that orientation left such a sour note to our dining experience. It was as if they were trying to convince us not to dine here. Although their food and arrangement of food station set up is great, I guess I have to grant their wish to take my future business elsewhere.
author: Elaine Y.

description: The best part was the lychee ice cream at the end. Yes! I would come back for the complimentary ice cream at the end. Derive was a trend and stir staff checked on us often. Try the premium beef- it probably was the best cut on the menu. The lamb was amazing too-soft and tender. The both was flavorful as compared to the other buffet. They have a seafood, veggies, and noodle buffet in addition to the sauce station. The place was very clean. Our bill came out about $134 for 4 people.
author: Desiree N.

description:
Great hot pot spot on Taraval. I used to live on this street so this was definitely my go to. I prefer this place over Simmer. 

-B
author: Brandon G.

description:
First time coming here and it was great! Love the selection of side dishes available and the service was good. We came here when there weren't that many people so the server was attentive. But when it started getting crowded, it was a little hard on the server as there was only one person working. It didn't matter too much, as we already got our orders down and were settled in. 
The food was great, we tried the rib eye, wagyu, and supreme beef. All were quite meaty and delicious when soaked in the broth( we got the beef broth and curry broth/medium spice)and dipped in my own concoction. I love the self service side bar and sauce bar! I can choose whatever quantity of sides and sauce to myself without having to ask for more from the waitress. 
The desserts at the end weren't that great, but it was okay since the main course was quite filling.

Definitely will come back another time!
author: Leanna L.

description:
Had tried to come here a few times but it was always busy. And ended up across the street at KoT.

Today is a national holiday so I thought let's see if it is open. Dinner at 6:15 and it is and it's practically empty! What?!

Service. Amazing. Never had to call out to servers because before I even had to look up, one of them was in their way! So good!  Definitely a change of pace for hot pot joints.  Service was very friendly and hospitality was evident from all the workers. I enjoyed hearing them give a "method to the madness" to some newbies to hot pot.

The broth was okay. Had the miso and the rich beef. Nothing much to talk about. Felt like there was something missing---like depth in flavor. 

I enjoyed and was grateful for the variety of vegetables and meats besides the shabu meat on the menu. Yes the menu selection is limited but what makes up for it is the sides and veggies and other meats like tripe and beef tendon.  The dipping sauces were limited. It.mightve been me but the sesame sauce tasted off. And yay tons of garlic!

Ended the meal with cute dessert-lychee ice cream and watermelon sago! The sago was presented in a baby food glass container.  

Definitely happy it was pick your own sides so you can get up, move around, and make some space to eat more.
author: John Michael R.

description:
What can be better than signing up on the waitlist through yelp?!? 
Okay, this place does not have the best quality of meat for the price you pay. BUT it's not bad. The rib eye is definitely more fatty than the supreme beef. BUT BUT BUT, that is not well dinner is worth 5 stars here. The service here is great! Servers are constantly checking on us, making sure we are doing fine and if we needed something else. And everything came out super fast compared to other AYCE hot pot places. The taste is great, but I do wish the meat was a little more fatty. Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely come back again.
author: Emily H.

description:
Most Cantonese folks have traditionally grown up having hot pots at home. It's one of my fondest memories, as this was always considered a special treat in our household. Whenever I came back home, after getting a "real job" and thus, becoming a"real adult", my Dad would ask what I wanted for dinner whenever I went back home to visit, and hot pot was always my first request. It makes me teary-eyed just thinking about those good ole' days, and Cantonese-style hot pots will always have a special place in my heart.

Well, this kind of dreary weather has had me craving to be around a huge bubbling hot pot, surrounded by an endless amount of meats, veggies, and tons of classic hot pot sides. So, of course, we came to Fiery Hot Pot. This is my favorite hot pot restaurant of all. Hands down, no doubt!! Why?

- Fresh veggies and lots of great sides, all self-served, but nicely presented in individual containers. Most everything you'd want in a Cantonese hot pot is here. Think fresh and fried tofu, shrimp, tendons, fresh and baby corn, lotus roots, a variety of mushrooms, including enoki and wood ear mushrooms, tripe, mussels, bean thread noodles, udon noodles, ramen noodles etc. Plus a variety of greens, including spinach, baby Bok Choy and watercress. If you have vegetarian leanings, you can live on this section alone.

- Fresh meats and fish.  I usually get the rib eye and American Kobe style beef. The chicken was dry, so I wouldn't suggest that, and I haven't tried the lamb, so unable to comment on these. For me, it's "Where's the beef"?

- Excellent, clean presentation. The self-serve section is very well maintained. It's not some sloppy picked-over buffet. Again, the buffet items are served in individual containers, so no need to pick up a serving utensil that 25 others have just touched with their yucky germ filled hands. I'm no germophobe, but that's how germs are passed, and that's how you get sick. No worries about that here.  Really like this clean sanitary concept!!

- Modern, clean, relaxed decor. 

- Friendly, attentive service. Refills for sodas, water and broth showed up often, without even asking for them. Imagine that, in a Chinese restaurant. Wow! It can be done! They need to share their best practices with other Chinese restaurants.

- Flat price ($28.00/pp) includes bottomless soda, AYCE food, free rice and even a choice of two desserts.  No trying to nickel and dime you for a $2.00 bowl of rice, etc. So tired of that b.s. You won't encounter that crap here.

- No SF Healthy Tax added to your bill! Wonderful!! This is the way it should be EVERYWHERE!!! It maybe rolled into the price, but not added as a separate charge, which is just plain untransparent. Restaurants who add a separate charge don't want to roll into the cost of the food, in fear that people will see the prices, and won't want to pay the added cost. But, at the end of the day, you ARE paying it. So just be upfront about it, like this place, and tell it like it is. It is what it is, so don't try to hide it. This restaurant deserves kudos for this!
 
I must admit that their set-up might even be better than what we had at home. Of course, in my book, there's nothing better than sitting around a table with family in your own home, but there's no clean up here. Moreover, realistically, you're just probably not going to have like 40 plus kinds of different foods. It just isn't done on such a grand scale at home. However, you can have it all here!!!
author: Lori N.

description: Honestly, iPot has better quality meats, it feels cleaner, and there is less walking involved. But Fiery Hot Pot is really nice. It is buffet-style, so you can get the ingredients you want for your hot pot yourself (except not the meat). It has a cute veggie section, a good selection of noodles and random seafood/small meats, and the broth is pretty good. Nothing really stood out, but next time we want to save a few bucks and wait for less time we will come here instead of iPot.
author: Steph C.

description:
I'm a vegetarian and yet I loved this place. There is just one vegetarian broth, and it is delicious. The buffet had tonnes of options, even vegetarian ones, which was surprising.


I initially thought it was expensive, given I won't even consume meat there, but then it turned out to be worth every penny.
author: Prateek K.

description:
Hurray Hot Pot! 

You know that feeling when you love something, and you get to introduce someone else to it. The excitement that they might love it too, mixed with a little fear that something will go wrong and they'll hate it. That's how I typically feel when taking new people to Hot Pot. This trip was a huge success and now I have more friends to go to have hot pot with. The reason I bring this up, is because the service, staff, cleanliness of this place really made the experience great instead of just "OK". 

The staff was very helpful and attentive. The buffet was filled with lots of fresh veggies and noodles and great things to make soup :) The meat was very good, the soup base was fantastic, and they did a great job of keeping everything topped up and running smoothly. 

Also, the beer is cheap! For $10/person the whole table can get all you can drink beer and sake. This is my challenge for next time. Now I want hot pot again...
author: John W.

description:
Tips: 
1. Get on the waitlist. They allow you to put your name in the system electronically . So I would enter my name while heading there. 
2. Come hungry
3. $28 AYCE add $10 for all you can drink draft beer and sake. 
4. Ask for what-they-called-Waygu ( but I think it's Kobe beef). It's not on the menu but included in the price. But honestly, I personally like their ribeye.
5. I scream Ice cream...so good! The piña colada ice cream is uh-mazing. I had to ask for second! 

Overall, great customer, many high quality dishes, various veggies and side dishes that you get to pick out yourself. One thing thou, they need to keep the seafood items on the menu so they can be kept fresh. I don't like how they have seafood dishes sitting out. Not sure why it wasn't too crowded. 
For the price, amount and quality of their service, You need to give them a try!
author: Jessica Doan N.

description: The food is ok, the environment is good, option isn't too much compare to other hot pot places and it's a little overpriced especially when you have a group of people (actually only 6 of us) there and they will charge you an extra service fee. So we ended up with $43 each person. Which we all thing doesn't worth it...
author: Patricia L.

description:
Now, I normally don't go out of my way for hot pot because I simply find other places more delicious (KBBQ, burger, Asian fusion, etc.) BUT if the homies are craving hot pot, then I'll join. 

Was hanging in the city of San Francisco all day and decided to grab dinner. We were at Dolores Park before this and looked for an Asian restaurant close by. Came here and there was a not-too-bad wait. 

The hot places that I went to usually give us sides when we order them, so I was thoroughly surprised at the amount of sides available for us to just get up and grab from the other side of the room. I definitely like the idea of AYCE "serve yourself" hot pot better, and the meat/broth here was delicious!! I believe we ordered the wagyu meat? Well anyways, it was all good, and pass my test for someone who doesn't really go to hot pot. 

Will definitely be back here whenever I'm in the city.
author: Matt D.

description:
Got rules? 
Time limit on eating. No problem. Was informed 3 times before we even got our broth. Guess they're pretty serious about that.
Oh? Can't have 2 separate bowl of broth even tho they sat us in a table with 2 burners with 3 adults and 2 kids. Keep in mind we only wanted 2 different kind of soup. Hmm ok..
We charge extra if you waste food.. okay got it..

Aside from the unwelcoming early presentation, food was ok. Waygu kinda trash....I would go with the supreme beef. Beef broth was flavorful but it's heavy so can hit flavor fatigue quickly. Selections of items are decent but definitely less than competitors
author: Eddy M.

description: Love that you can choose your individual hot pot ingredients. We had a group of 11 - highly recommended making reservations and getting there when they first open. The wait and waitlist is usually two hours because you have two hours of all you can eat! Very clean and great choices and great service. Fresh ingredients and always restocked quickly. The broth choices are all fantastic! I had the vegetarian broth! First time try N.C. hot pot and truly enjoyed it.
author: June R.

description:
I've been to this hot pot place twice hoping to love it, but I just think it's okay. Fiery Hot Pot is an all you can eat hot pot place located on Taraval. 

What I love most about this place is that at the back of the restaurant there is a station where you can create your own sauce. They have so many different sauces you can combine to make your own plus ingredients like jalapeño, garlic, ginger, and cilantro. 

They also have all the vegetables and hot pot ingredients in small bowls out back so you can grab what you want to eat. You don't have to place an order for your veggies, just grab what you want and bring it to your table. For the premium meats, you do have to place an order with the server. 

While I love the concept, I'm not a fan of their soup base. Both times I went, we got the split pot so that we can try different soups. The first time, we got the spicy beef and the spicy pork. The second time we got the curry and the spicy miso. Out of all four soup bases, I think the curry was the most delicious and the most flavorful. My friends loved the spicy beef. The rest of the soup bases were a little disappointing. I feel it wasn't flavorful enough. And when it comes to hot pots, the soup base is the most important because that's what the whole meal revolves around.
author: Andrea G.

description: Excellent hot pot.  The waitlist worked out well. The beef, shrimp and fish filet were very fresh. Mix your own sauces worked well and had all the major flavors I like.  Also very convenient to have the non meat options there for you to pick out on your own.  So you did not have to wait for those food items.  Nice selection of veggies, tofu and several kinds of mushrooms. Space is clean and modern.  Meter spaces nearby.
author: T C.

description: Y'all. Let me be real with you. I've been to SEVERAL hot pot spots in my time. And let me tell you this: the presentation? IMPECCABLE. The pork broth? PHENOMENAL. The desert choice? ADORABLE. The service was incredible, Kayla pretty much read our minds the entire time. We even considered getting more meat? There she was ready to take our order like we had called upon her. She was an angel of the service industry and we will be returning for her and her alone but also because the food was bomb. Thank you and goodnight.
author: Isabella S.

description:
This is my fave hot pot in the area but only when I've got time to spare. 

There are a few ingredients I love that I haven't seen at other hot pot buffets (though maybe I'm trying the wrong spots?) like dandelion greens and woodear mushrooms that make this spot stand out for me.

Prepare for a LONG wait on a weekend and expect the waitlist to take a while... Maybe get a round or two at the Deuces about ten minutes down Taraval and then sneak back up for food?

If you want to sit quickly: no. If you've got some time: enjoy your prefunc and hot pot.
author: Anastasia Z.

description:
Yummy serve yourself AYCE hot pot! We got the pork and beef broth, with the beef being my favorite. For meat we tried all the beef cuts and our favorite was the supreme and ribeye. Meat quality was good and tender.

They have a ton of grab and go plates with veggies, seafood, noodles, and other hot pot ingredients. You can also make your own sauce at the sauce station. Price was $28.99 and also included drinks and dessert. We loved the watermelon sago cups we got at the end of the meal. 

Our server was awesome. He was incredibly attentive and constantly delivered plates of meat and took away empty ones. Definitely a good hot pot addition to the city.
author: Sophia H.

description:
We waited for about 30 minutes before we got seated but service is soo good. they keep on refilling our drinks and politely asked if we want more meat. we tried other hot pot spots after this but hubby said Fiery's beef broth is the best among them all.

TIP: join their wait list here in yelp. they are crazy busy especially on weekends.
author: Lupe G.

description:
This place is AYCE and serves some pretty decent hot pot. We had a reservation so there was pretty much no wait when we went.

You start of the order choosing up to two flavors per pot of the soup flavors you want. We tried the coconut curry one and the beef one. You can then order a selection of meets (there were like two beefs, one pork belly, and one chicken maybe?), and they bring those out to you as you finish them.

There is also a side area where you can pick up a variety of vegetables and seafood, buffet style. There was a pretty good selection here ranging from spinach and other veggies to mushrooms, to shrimp and fish balls. Also a nice selection of dipping sauces.

The soups themselves were more for dipping, the flavor of the soup is a bit strong so its not much of a sipper one for me, and after a while after everything cooks in there the soup looks a bit murky. I liked the coconut curry one but the beef one had this kind of almost herbal taste to it that I didn't really enjoy that much, but was good for just cooking plain beef in.
author: Tyler T.

description:
First time at Fiery and boy was I Furious. It was series of disappointments. I put my name on the waitlist through yelp and received a text that our table will be ready in about five minutes. My whole group of seven waited patiently outside for my name to be called since it was packed inside. After about 10 minutes, we checked the waitlist and somehow was removed. We asked the server and she said she called my name out inside and gave our table away. We told her we were waiting outside the whole time and she said sorry I didn't go outside but she will give us the next available table. The party that took our table wasn't all present yet (1 out of 8 was there). 

Finally got seated at a table that had two burners... when we started ordering our soup base, server says since we have four adults and three kids, we can only have 1 pot of soup. Their explanation is: since the three kids are under the age of 3, we don't charge them and therefore you can only get 1 pot of soup and if we want an extra pot we would be charged $20 extra.

Fast forward to checkout: to our surprise, we got charged an 18% gratuity  even though the charge is for four adults. They didn't give us an extra pot of soup because they were not charging for the kids but they're ok with charging us a service fee because we had kids. 

Overall experience was bad because the customer service and stingy management. Food was decent, meat was mediocre, selection was average. In my opinion, for the price of $30, there's better places with better selections of food and definitely better service.
author: Wanda L.

description:
Nice hot pot place

Saw the video review from "strictly dumpling" on youtube--decided to check this place out. The place is special in that a lot of the all-you-can-eat hotpot ingredients are laid out on a station in the front, and you can walk up and take any item you want. We took a lot of sweet sausages :) There was also veggies, sauces, fish balls, scallops etc.

For the meat slices, you still have to order them from the wait staff. The premium beef was awesome--it was served in a "flower" formation, rolled up. It looked small, but actually had a lot of meat inside, compared to being laid out flat on plate. It took a long time for us finish the beef roll. The soup based was pretty nice too, with decent spiciness.

The wait staff are friendly. Food comes reasonably quickly. There is a free dessert in the form of a watermelon shot, which was a great way to cool down after eat spicy hotpot

Overall, a good hotpot place
author: Henry L.

description: Fast, friendly, and attentive service with a generous selection of fresh ingredients.  Definitely my neighborhood go-to!
author: Roger E.

description:
$28 AYCE for 90 minutes. Ready, set, go!

Love the buffet concept for the veggies, mushrooms, dipping sauce, and noodles. As for meat, you order at your table. There's a good selection of broth to choose from, and as for dessert, the lychee ice cream was the best!!! Since I have such a big sweet tooth, that might've been the highlight of the meal actually haha. 

Overall, this is your standard hot pot place, but with a buffet with pretty presentation. If you like hot pot it's worth a try.
author: Corinna T.

description:
This place is my go to when I'm trynna get my grub on playa. The name implies it all! It is LIT! 
Fiery like the embers on Kanye. 
Eat here.

You wont be disappointed!
author: Dj K.

description:
One of the place that does hot pot right. When you searching for hot pot places in San Francisco, the results can be overwhelming. We picked Fiery because it was the closest. The place is not small and wait staff was very friendly, we arrived at around 7pm on a not so busy Monday night. Got seated right away, picked our pot and since we have a long flight, we chose not to do the all you can drink (extra 10 dollars per person). 

Great selections of meats from American Kobe beef, to prime beef, to lamb and chicken to pork and fish. The rest of the hot pot items are on display, like buffet style, you pick what you want to eat and we were very impressed with their selections. Sauce bar needs more work, I suggest them to add red beancurd and leek flower sauce to suit the northern chinese's taste. Other than that, great place for hot pot, 30 dollars per person might seem steep but it is worth it. We will be back again!
author: William C.

description: Treat yourself to a good hot pot.  Very clean, good service for hot pot in the city.  This is one of the many hot pot buffet in San Francisco, but they still do it right.  I don't like the time limit, 2 hours, but I did like the hot pot and the service.
author: David E.

description: Very orderly and clean. A variety of Neatly displayed portions, great & attentive service. Food is very good, sauces included.
author: Danielle Y.

description:
First time here after a whole year of bookmarking this place. The exterior looks tiny, but it's not as small as you would think as you walk in. We got seated right away since we got there around 7:20 on a Monday night. The menu is small so it's not hard picking what you want. You get to choose up to two broths like many hot pot places. This is AYCE for $29 per person which is a usual price point for AYCE everywhere. For our broths, we chose the 
vegetarian spicy miso and the beef broth. They offer a buffet style for the sides like ramen, udon, fish balls and fish cakes, etc. For the meat, you order wit the staffs and they're very efficient with it so you get to eat all the meat you want without time wasted. I first tried the broth and both broths were very intense with flavor. However, I thought the meat tasted a bit funny, it looks fresh and all but it had this taste to it. Overall service was good, but I didn't think this place was all that.
author: Lisa W.

description:
First and foremost, shout out to our server who also spoke with me on the phone about the availability of tables. He encouraged us to please come and we even took his recommendation on broth choice (spicy beef and roast pork). 

The price as of this review is 29$ per person which is average price for most ayce hot pot. I would even go to say that it's a thriftier option. Soda and tea is included as well. While most shabu places will give you an assortment of options for their soup add ins, this place has a buffet like station to pick up whatever type of noodle, vegetable, tofu and others you wish to enjoy. What's great is that it minimizes waste for the restaurant and allows the servers to focus on drinks and meat orders. In addition, it allows eaters like me to pile on my favorites without filling up on items I don't enjoy. 

The place looks fairly new by the decor and include a few tvs to watch sports. 

This place is a must go in terms of value, service and atmosphere. I can't wait to come back!
author: Joel Christian A.

description:
One of the better AYCE hot pot restaurants, in my opinion! I came with my bf for dinner after seeing some yelp pictures. It's $28 per person, which is standard AYCE price. We also ordered some lychee soju for $12. Since we came early at 5pm, there was no wait, but by the time we finished eating around 6:30, there was a crowd in the front area.

You order your soup and meat with the server, and then visit the sauce bar and buffet in the back! The sauce bar had a few different sauce bases and the usual toppings like green onions, garlic, chili oil, etc. The buffet had anything you could ever want in your hotpot! I loved the fish tofu, fish ball with roe, diff types of tofu, quail eggs, and all the veggies. We ordered the pork bone broth and tried the rib eye, wagyu (daily special), and lamb. I liked how everything came in small portions so you could get as little or as much as you please. Even the meat came in smaller portions than usual, which may be bad for big groups, but is perfect when you're only with one other person like me.

The service was suuuper friendly. I would come back because everything was yummy! The total price was a lil expensive, but I guess that's expected with all you can eat.
author: Tara A.

description: Another great meal at fiery hotpot... ben the waiter is the best. Very nice guy and top notch service. Thanks for the great service ben!
author: Eddie C.

description:
This is my new fav ayce hot pot place. Came on a friday night around 7:30pm, 5 min wait.

I haven't written a review in years, but I had to for this place. I actually prefer this place over the other hot pot places on taraval because the service is fast, wait time is quick, and they have really good quality cuts of beef. 

Ayce for $28 and comes with free fountain drink served in cute mason jars. Although I didn't see it on the menu, wagyu beef is an option! I also love how the hot pot side dish station was self serve so you don't need to wait or flag down waiters to get refills.

They also provided complimentary green tea & lychee flavored ice cream at the end.

Waiter also came by a few times to check if everything was good. Overall this place deserves all 5 stars.
author: Cindy L.

description: Really good food. Reasonable price. The staff is very polite and explain the menu really well. Been here 5+ times now and have nothing to complain about
author: Armaan B.

description:
Our group came here when we found out the long wait time for another hotpot place and came out stuffed and happy. 

Pluses: 
1) They allow you to put your name on the list prior to coming in
2) Buffet of sides is pretty extensive and gives people plenty of options for dinner. The portions are well managed so you can always go back for more
3) The meat slices are HUGE! The brisket and supreme beef were both delicious
4) They also offer all you can drink for not all that much more ($7 or $8). Otherwise, you can just grab a pitcher of beer for less than $10. 
5) They include two different desserts as part of the payment: a mango sorbet or a honey dew rice pudding thingy

Cons:
1) They spiral the lamb and supreme beef into a rose shape which looks nice but is a PAIN to unravel to eat. You end up just having to tear all the pieces apart to get a thin slice to cook. 
2) It would be good if there was more table space...or if maybe they collected plates faster. We ran out of space a little bit though not terrible
3) They seem pretty strict on their time limit and suggest only being seated once everyone in the party is there because once the party is seated, even if not complete, the clock starts
4) They're really far away... hard to get there without a car

All-in-all, pretty good. Better than some other AYCE hotpot places in the same price range.
author: Liza X.

description:
Food 4.5/5
Service 5/5
Interior 5/5
Ventilation 5/5


Omg... why haven't I been to this AYCE hotpot location before except now. This place is really solid!! Went on weekday around 7pm with no wait time at all. The staff was really attentive and asked immediately if we want something to drink because it was included in the AYCE price of $27.99 !! He also came around asking if we wanted more meat which doesn't happen often at AYCE hotpot. Maybe because it wasn't that busy when we came in, but afterwards it was busy and he was still attentive and made sure that we had a good experience!! 
We got the MALA Spicy beef broth & Regular Beef broth. OMG, i never tried such flavorful brother before!! Once your beef is cooked from the soup, the beef doesn't even need the additional dipping of the sauce!! WOW, really never tasted beef that great with just the broth alone.

Besides the Meat, there is a station where you get your own veggies, random sausages, fishcake, shrimp, noodles, and etc. Which I think is great because you get to choose as much as you want without having to ask the waiter! Saves so much time!!! 

The sauces are decent, wish they had a better "chilli oil" to be honest, but who cares! Their broth cover all the dipping sauces! I'm impressed with the exceptional service from the server and the owner I believe? 



OMG, they have BOOOOOOOMMMMMMBB asSSSSSSSAASSSSS Watermelon Sago and Lychee Ice Cream!! Holy shit! It was so refreshing to drink the watermelon sago after having such "heaty" hotpot. ( If they actually sell Watermelon Sago, I won't mind coming once a week to buy the drink, HAHAHA).  

Will definitely come back here!! Highly Recommended.
P.S their ventilation is one of the best(you can hear it blasting near the front counter area!!  I always walk out AYCE HotPot Place smelling like... I was in the kitchen  war ZONE!!  which isn't pleasant.... and the smell lingers afterwards. With this place though, man I did not STANK!!! There was little to no smell from the hotpot on my clothing or my hair. Usually my hair would capture any type of smell pretty quickly, but after walking out, my hair still smell like my conditioner! Thank you for such great ventilation!
author: Anney T.

description:
Love that it is buffet style! 

First you order the soup base and  drinks  with the waitress then you head over to the bar and grab whatever it is that you want.  There are great selections of seafood, different types of noodles, all the veggies you can think of. Unlimited sodas comes with the all you can eat option. 

Service was amazing.

Price: 28/person
As of Sept 2018, it's $31/person for all you can eat. 
You can get all you can drink for $12/person. Everyone in your party must get it though. 

Soju is served in a mason jar! I love all things mason jar related!!

Got the spicy broth and miso broth, both were delicious. 

Would definitely come back on a rainy, cold day.
author: Caitlin P.

description: This hot pot restaurant was refered by a friend of my, just happened to be in the neighborhood.  This will be one of my to go places.  Met the waitress Lin today, she is very friendly, keep our cups full all the time.   Great customer service.  The food was clean and precise. The meat was very fresh.   The bathroom is very clean.  I will be going back to this restaurant again.
author: Thomas L.

description: So yummy warm spicy broth with different pieces of meat and my favorite bokchoy. We are on a special way of eating called Keto but we were able to enjoy. My daughter liked the ramen. The variety was worth the price. Once we finished eating we were offered desert. The service was great. He checked on us often and made sure we had what we wanted. He also took the time to explain how the hotpot buffet worked.
author: T. Allen G.

description: Solid hot pot spot with good quality meats and good selection of vegetables, noodles, and seafood. It costs $28 per person for AYCE, which also includes drinks like soda and juice. The meats are ordered a la carte, and everything else is buffet style. The service is great - servers frequently check up on the table about ordering more food and refilling drinks.
author: Christine L.

description: Big high five to Mon, his customers service is really awesome!!! Food is very comfort! We will surely comeback!!+
author: Jholor S.

description:
We came here on a Friday night as a very large party for a birthday. 

They are AYCE and drink with a 90 minute limit (a little short considering other places I've been to have a 120 minute limit).  They are 1/2 buffet style and 1/2 order.  The sliced meats are ordered from the wait staff and all other items (veggies, various balls, hot dogs, spam, tendon, tripe, carbs, etc) are located at the buffet in the back of the restaurant.  Some of the leafy greens at the buffet were a little wilty or showed some browning.  They also have a DIY sauce bar including peanut, soy, xo and other various sauces.  Unfortunately they did not have a chili or chili oil type sauce.  A light dessert is included in the AYCE. 

Broth: There was a decent selection of broths, at our table we chose veggie miso, (very) spicy beef, spicy pork, and curry.  The broths were ok, but didn't really infuse the meats with much flavor (hence the sauce bar).  

Service:  The staff were very attentive.  We ordered several rounds of sake. Plates were cleared efficiently.  Considering how large our party was, the staff were troopers.  They even accommodated a cake at the end.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Solid hot pot place! Staff is friendly, and you get to choose all your non-meat options from a self serve bar. There's a bunch of different meat options which are all good to try! Price is $28.99, which is pretty standard for AYCE hot pot. There's also $10 for all you can drink alcohol! It's worth it if you can hang in since they have a selection of sake and soju.

Would highly recommend but keep in mind you have 90 minutes to eat!
author: Justin E.

description:
We had an early Valentine's Day dinner here the other night. You know I would've asked for Tasty Pot (aka torture for my bf), but I wanted to give him a break from always feeling obligated to eat there with me. He always goes, "Anything but Tasty Pot, please.." So out of love, I only did the next best thing and ate at a restaurant he liked!

We called in to put our names on the waiting list even though when we arrived there was no wait. We were seated immediately. I guess it just depends because I heard it can be one hell of a wait. 

We were allowed to choose two broths and so we went with one of the meat broths (idk which...) and some spicy one. We ordered the same four meats constantly: rib eye, supreme beef, premium lamb shoulder, and fillet-of-sole. They had an endless self-serve bar serving a variety of seafood/meat balls, shellfish, noodles, veggies, and oo seaweed salad (love dis!!) I'm not super into veggies when I eat hot pot - I literally just eat napa cappage. They've got a variety of sauces as well. I couldn't find a combo that I really liked, but I did try their ponzu, sesame sauce, and satay sauce. I would recommend the ponzu and satay sauce. Don't expect it to taste like shabu though because the broth flavor is a little overpowering.

It was $27.99/pp AYCE with unlimited soda/lemonade too! What I loved most about the place is that they servers were very attentive and always there when you needed them. It wasn't the annoying kind of attention too. They serve complimentary dessert (which you can also have unlimited of) also. I heard they usually have other flavors, but what they were offering were ice cream and grass jelly dessert. I actually really liked the grass jelly dessert! 

I'd come to visit again as long as there's no wait!
author: Sydney C.

description:
When an establishment has a bunch of people lining up, then you know the place is gonna be good. That's what I felt as I walked up to the restaurant. Prior to this, I was looking up a good hot pot spot on Yelp for my family to dine at; we haven't had hot pot in a while. So, it was kind of a mission to pick from all the various hot spot restaurants in SF, eventually we chose Fiery from all the positive reviews. And it was a damn good choice we picked Fiery.

First, they had a Yelp waitlist, this made the wait much more bearable as we didn't have to go there to get on the waitlist. I liked the decor and the 5 TVs they had in good viewing angles.

Onto the food, for an AYCE $28 meal, this place is worth it, it includes a drink, AYCE-whatever-food-pleases-your-belly, and a dessert! Our family ordered just about every cut of meat they had and they were all super tender when cooked in the hot pot. They also had a cut of meat that wasn't on the menu, American Wagyu, this was so good. On top of that, we didn't get any meat that was frozen, plus+! Great selection from the self-serve bar and for dessert, we could choose between grassjelly or black sesame ice cream, we all opted for the ice cream. It was good.
author: Sherman S.

description:
This is probably one of my favorite hot places in San Francisco (I just wish it wasn't so far away from me!)

I got the beef broth and the pork broth for my hot pot. The beef broth was... intimidatingly brown and much thicker than you would expect from a broth. Both tasted delicious, although I did prefer the pork as it was a little lighter in flavor.

The beauty of Fiery Hot Pot is that you don't have to wait to get your vegetables and starches - you can just go grab them from a back set up! And they have a ton of options for you to grab - vegetables, carbs, fish balls, seafood, etc. You do have to order meat with the server, but since they have less work to do now that they aren't delivering other items, they get it to you quickly and efficiently.

I'm 100% coming back!
author: Jessie Y.

description:
Made reservations yesterday for the next day. Easy and with a  call  later to confirm that we were coming. Very pleasant and comfortable while being seated. The service was fast and courteous and checked from time to time. The only bottomless soda available. The variety of veggies and meats is large for you to pick what you want. Desserts was available also and you can even ask for all of them, my favorite was the sesame seed ice cream.
Yes, I would return here again and bring friends.
author: Edward L.

description:
This is probably my new favorite hot pot spot. First time here and I'll definitely be returning. They basically have a "buffet" of sides which makes it so much easier, because you don't have to keep asking for more veggies and whatnot. When I first saw how big the sides selection was, it was like I was a kid in a candy store. I immediately went for the mussels and clams. I'm a seafood type of gal. The meats were beyond my expectations. You get to create your own sauce and they have a good variety to mix. 

This restaurant also has the best service I have ever experienced. They made sure we had enough room on our table (the tables are quite small especially when you load up with a lot of sides), made sure our drinks were filled, as well as making sure we were enjoying our meal. 

It's $27.99 per person but you get all your can drink soda and dessert which you can choose ice cream or grass jelly. With an extra $10 per person, you can get all your can drink booze! The ice cream tasted like it was house made. I got the lychee ice cream and it had bits of lychee jelly in it!! 

Overall, COME HERE FOR HOT POT AND GOOD SERVICE!!!!!!!
author: Theresa K.

description:
Only one experience here but definitely would come back again and since I don't live in the city I'm already wanting another trip here soon! 

Came here around 9 and was 3rd on the list but was sat maybe after 10-15min of waiting. It was very clean and they restock pretty often. The meats you order were really good and enough of a selection. The buffet part was a very small variety but it was good quality products. I love that they have different noodles some places only have udon or ramen. Our eyes were bigger than our stomachs we got so much on the first up we didn't go for seconds. Oh and warning the ponzu sauce it's the sweet ponzu. I wasn't expecting it so just a warning for people who like ponzu with hot pot. 

The broth is tasteful. I got the spicy beef with numbing. Which I don't recommend. I thought the numbing would be from the peppers being super spicy but it's actually an herb that numbs your tongue and throat. So with your tongue and throat numb it's just an awkward feeling while eating. 

Dessert: don't get the grass jelly. It's the canned type it's not good at all. 

Customer service: very nice, they refilled your waters, they ask if your doing okay just the right amount of times.
author: Jesse A.

description:
Definitely one of the more unique hot pot places in SF! 

Pros:
- Everything except the meat is self-serve. So you don't have to wait for servers to be able to grab vegetables or noodles
- The meat portions are smaller so it's much easier to not over order. They also bring it quite fast when you do order so that's not a concern
- The sauces here are bomb! You can mix your own sauce with a variety of ingredients and flavors
- Comes with unlimited drinks and dessert after dinner

Cons:
- I would say the diversity of your food selection tends to be a little bit lower here compared to most other hot pot places
- The broth was not my favorite. Tended to be a little bland and I couldn't really taste the difference between the beef and pork broth.

Overall, would definitely recommend coming here at least once! And I can see myself coming back if I'm in the area
author: Cassie Z.

description: Best hot pot buffet i've ever been to! Very reasonable price for the food they provide. Great sauce bar and selection of non-meat foods.
author: Jing Z.

description:
Went here on a Friday night with a friend around 6:30 pm and was immediately seated at a table for 4.  The restaurant had a few other open tables at this time.  A waiter came by, politely walked us through the menu options, sides, and soft drinks (which are inlcuded in the buffet).  It was particularly cold this evening, so we got two cups of hot water that came out quickly.  After looking at the menu, we decided on the lamb shoulder, ribeye and porkbelly with rich pork broth.  

What's particularly fun about this hot pot restaurant are the sides and sauces that are neatly displayed at a counter for pickup.  You just grab a tray and select the perfectly portioned sides that you want.  I picked up the lotus root, napa cabbage, shrimp balls, fried tofu fish cake, enoki mushrooms and some seaweed salad.  All were clean, fresh, crisp and ready to cook.  

Once we picked our sides and sauces (which you can easily make to fit your tastes) we headed back to the table where our meats were waiting.  I like a lot of garlic, cilantro and a small bit of hot sauce with soy and making this was a quick and fun process.  The hot pot is on an induction range and comes to cooking temperature very quickly.  We quickly placed our sides in the hotpot, let cook, removed and then added our meats.  Everything was very tasty and the sides cooked nicely.  Over the course of an hour, we were offered additional broth by their friendly and attentive staff through several rounds of cooking meats and sides.  

One thing to note is that they told us of their time limit prior to us ordering a second round of meats, which by my estimate, was a little over 1 hour.  Would definitely come back here again and highly recommend to those who are hungry for a great hot pot experience.
author: Henna P.

description: Tried this spot a while back & it was decent. Takes a while to find parking in this area, especially around dinner time. We probably circled around looking for parking for nearly 45 minutes. We were the only party in line with open tables but somehow still waited 30 minutes to be seated.The soup bases are pretty basic & the meat was just alright. It wasn't a bad experience but nothing spectacular. It's cool that the side are set up like a buffet bar & in small portions so that you can control how much you get/ waste. However I just wasn't really impressed by this spot. Had high hopes but left disappointed. Probably won't be returning
author: Diana N.

description:
TBH, I always thought this place was one of those hot pot places that was gonna shut down after a few months... I was COMPLETELY wrong! It's been THE hot pot spot for myself and the Lady since we first went a few months back! 

Food wise, they got some high quality meats and great soup bases! They don't joke when they said they home make their broths! I'm also a huge fan of the sidedish bar! Perfectly portioned out, grab your own, side dishes with a decent variety to choose from! Helps control yourself from making the mistake of ordering too much and stuffing yourself to avoid over charge fees. 

I think they are getting more popular by the day... so don't be surprised if there is a line if you try to go!
author: Tyler D.

description:
One of the best hot pot spots in the Sunset.
-Service is great
-All you can drink soda along with meal
-Free Dessert 
-sauce station (the dream) 
-easy to find parking during weeknights 

All for $28! Say whaaaaaa?!
author: Andy C.

description:
This is my favorite hot pot place! I have only been here at least 8 times and every time they don't disappoint me. Service is GREAT! The servers are very polite and checks in frequently to see if everything is okay and to see if you need more meat or drinks. The food is good and in good portions. The restaurant is very clean and the self service area is very clean and alway replenished. 
Today we went to celebrate a birthday and they were thoughtful enough to have a slice of cheese cake with the birthday person's name on it. It was an pleasant surprise. Reservation is always easy to make as long as it is made a day ahead. Thank you for always making our experience great!!!!
author: Annie P.

description:
100% 5 Star review. One of the absolute best hot pot in the city. Perfect combination of great food and service. They have Wagyu! (American, but still Wagyu!). I recommend the spicy coconut curry and the rich pork. The are fast with the meat and will check frequently to make you you are maximizing your meat intake. They have a buffet where you can get mussels, clams, lobster balls, spam and much more. 

When you ask for the check they give you two options for dessert! Use ice cream or jelly. 

Go here!
author: Josh L.

description: The service was nice. They will come bay and ask how we are doing and if we need anything. The meat thinly sliced and fresh. We tried the premium pork, dumpling, wagu, beef and some of the buffet items. We got a ying yueng broth. The spicy mild was not spicy enough to me, but was still delicious. The setting is small bjt lots of saudes. They had sesame, scallions, cilantro, ponzu, soy sauce, garlic, hot sauce, chilli sauce, etc.  For the buffet, theykeep everything in a mini frige which keeps if fresh. You can choose spam, fish balls, beef balls, tofu,greens, mushrooms, noodles and other stuff. The selection the have for a small dinning is pretty nice.
author: Bonnie C.

description: Quality of ingredients seems to be good here.  Been here only once but I would visit again if I have hot pot cravings.  If you can grab a reservation around 6-7, I would go and spend the most time on wagyu their best cut, and try some of their neatly arranged veggies and sides. Smart all you can eat goers usually focus most of their appetite on the meat but what's the fun in hot pot if you don't try all the variety of fish balls and mushrooms?  They also have Japanese sausage which in the beginning we were questioning but once steeped in hot boiling soup really yummy and shockingly had the real Japanese sausage taste.
author: D Y.

description:
Upon seeing reviews of AYCE HOT POT for $28, I was so excited to try this place, but sadly was disappointed as the meal went on. 

For starters, you can get 3 meats at a time, choice of two broths, self serve buffet of whatever veggies, seafood, noodles, sauces, and extra fix ins your like. Seriously love myself unlimited Supreme Beef, Enoki, Tripe, and Udon. Also appreciated how clean and fresh all the ingredients looked and how fast they replenished everything. 

The sad side was that the meal was fantastic for the first 30 minutes and it went down hill. Once they refilled our broths with what I think was hot water, the broth tasted watery and flavorless. A big part of a hot pot experience is the broth and this was saddening. To make things worse, the server looked at us weirdly when we asked for bowls and soup spoons. Is that seriously something weird to ask when you are having soup? Just these little things and overall taste took away from the awesome price point and unlimited toppings. I hope to try this place again to have the same awesome experience other yelpers are having!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: It was my first time eating here and I had a great experience! My party called in and reserved 4 seats. The waiters were very nice and everything was quick. The beef and pork broth were awesome. Toward the end of the night they served us a wider variety of beef and even gave us desert on the house! I would definitely go here again!
author: Jayson S.

description:
Was so lucky to find parking and be seated with a brief wait moments before the Friday night dinner rush.  Hands down one of the best hot pot restaurants in SF.  Excellent, attentive service.  Clean sidebar that is continuously restocked with fresh vegetables and fixings for your pot.  Way more efficient than waiting for understaffed servers to remember what you asked for 10 min ago.  The servings of meat are generous per order.  Icing on the cake is that AYCE fee includes bottomless drinks and one scoop of ice cream with your check.  Extra props for clean bathroom!

Be advised.  When they say that the spicy broth is numbingly spicy, they are not f*cking around!
author: Carter Y.

description:
Gosh, i'm a sucker for hot pot.   Fiery Hot pot took over the old G-Cube place.   This place takes reservations, so it's best to call ahead.   They need everyone in your party to be present when you arrive before they can give you a table.  The staff were are super nice and polite throughout our whole experience. 

Their menu is small because most of their items are at the counter.  You do need to pick your meat items and soup base from the menu.  You can have a split soup base and there isn't an extra cost for that.  A major plus!  They have 5 choices for the soup base- Rich roast beef, Rich Pork, Rice-less porridge, Vegetarian Miso, and fiery spicy beef.   I ended up getting the Rich pork and my friend got the Fiery Spicy beef.  They will ask you how spicy you want it and they will do their best to make it for you. My friend chose the super extreme spice level.  The waiter tried to warn us, but we insist.   I tried my friends Fiery spicy beef and it was flavorful, but a little too spicy for me.  The Rich pork was good and went well with the items i put in . 

Their meat selection consist of Rib eye, supreme beef, chicken, lamb, pork belly, pork shoulder, filet, housemade dumplings and pigs blood.   My friend and i stuck to the rib eye, supreme beef, and pigs blood. I liked the rib eye more, because to me that one was more tender, but my friend was the opposite of me and liked the Supreme beef more.  So you be the judge. 

And now for the items the counter.  They had taro, pumpkin, veggies, fried tofu, spam and so much more.  I love the taro and the fried tofu.   They also have woodear and lobster balls and fish balls with roe. I love the fish balls!  Their quail eggs were a good portion and they had different types of noodles too.  You can create you own sauces at the sauce bar.   

I guess the best advantage about this place is that you don't always have to flag down a waiter to order things.  You can just get up and grab it yourself.   Your order includes unlimted soft drinks.   They have root beer, lemonade, coke, sprite, fanta and diet coke for you to chose from.    In addition you can order their soju or sake choices.   The staff here was super nice, but i think they should have a place to write down your name and your party, because i was asked by 3 different staff, at 3 different times how many people were in my party and if they were here.   They should find a better way to keep track of that information.  They have so many TVs here, so it's a great place for those who want to catch up to their Warriors or Giants game
author: Belinda C.

description:
Been wanting to try this place for a while. Came for dinner early on a Friday night and wasn't too busy. Overall, I had a good experience here. This restaurant is still relatively new and I just loved how clean it felt.

I tried the fiery spicy beef and the rich pork broth. The broths were good although I chose medium for the fiery spicy beef. Not sure what sort of peppers they use but it's the kind of spicy that leaves your tongue tingly. Wasn't able to handle too much of that before I stuck to only using the rich pork broth. 

They have a large assortment on veggies and other food neatly placed on a counter for grabs. I like the concept, quick and easy. For the meats such as lamb and beef, they were nicely presented in a rose. Service was also good. The workers were very attentive and nice. Definitely coming back.
author: Annie H.

description:
REVIEWER # 25

Yup! This restaurant has definitely earned their five stars! This new restaurant on the block is the big news around town and if you don't hurry and try this place, you will regret it!

DID YOU KNOW: That this restaurant is owned by two couples! wowzers && they do a exceptional job at making their patrons happy!

I first found out about this restaurant as it was noted on Yelp as the "New Hot Business" around town! I knew I was trying to find a place to celebrate my roommate's birthday and I also knew that my roommates loved Hot Pot so this was a double score. I called the restaurant about 4 days in advance and spoke to a wonderful woman named Pansy! She answered the phone and once I told her I was celebrating a birthday, I let her know my roommates name and she told me that the restaurant would do something nice for my roommate because of the birthday celebration (whoa, that took a lot of hassle off me). 

My roommates and I arrived to the restaurant and noticed that upon walking in the restaurant was not busy at all considering that it was 7PM. We were greeted right away by server Leo! Once we sat down Leo went over how everything works and the menu. This restaurant is all you can eat hot pot for $28 which is limited to 90 minutes. But who's counting?! This has to be the best thing I have heard in a while!

HOW IT WORKS:
1. You get to choose 2 out of 3 different types of broth. The options are: Vegetarian Miso, Spicy or mild. 
2. Then you get to choose what type of meat you want. They have a wide variety ranging in choices of Lamb, Chicken or beef.
3. You choose your drink type. They have the option of all you drink for $10 extra charge! Amazing!!
4. Then you go to the back table layout where there are many many options of veggies, seafood and sauces that you can pick to put into your soup.
I love that that the restaurant gives you the option to create your own sauces! This was the best part! 

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
The service here was stellar! From the beginning to the end. While we were eating our server Ray and our busser Jaden came by multiple times to check in to see if there was anything we needed. The empty plates and bowls were picked up immediately by Jaden who was quick! 

BIRTHDAY CELEBRATION:
After our meal arrived Leo and Pansy came out with a beautiful ice cream cupcakes decorated and catered for my roommate's birthday. Once they brought it to the table all the workers surrounded the table to sing happy birthday to my roommate. It even came a time where the whole restaurant started joining in by singing happy birthday and clapping at the end! It was such a wonderful moment (I caught it all on video, "I'm such a nerd, I know"). 

MY RATING:
Definitely a 5 star in my eyes! If I could give this place more stars I probably would! They totally beat my expectations from the beginning to the end. They have amazing customer service as well as provided exceptional and quick service once we were at the restaurant. 

I would definitely recommend coming to this restaurant and I have to admit that this wouldn't be my last time. Birthday events, hot dates?? Yup! This is the right location and place for that!

Thank you Pansy, Jaden and Ray for the amazing experience here! My roommates and I truly enjoyed ourselves and will be back very soon!

REVIEW 144/196
author: Porsche C.

description: This is my favorite place to eat hot pot, good foods , good service and comfortable clean
author: Iky C.

description:
When G Cube closed, Mr. Dubs and I were devastated. We loved G Cube and couldn't imagine loving another hot pot joint on Taraval again. Well, that was until Fiery Hot Pot Buffet opened in their place! Since the closing of G Cube (RIP), Fiery Hot Pot has turned into one of our faves!

Pros
+ Their roast beef broth is the best! Seriously, it only gets better as you dip beef in it.
+ Service is always top notch. 
+ With the buffet bar, you don't have to wait for them to bring you items like noodles, veggies or more sauce.
+ They give you free soda with AYCE.
+ Homemade dumplings are bomb.com.

Cons
- The last time we went, the roast beef broth was a little oily.
- The rib eye is served in the shape of a heart. While that is unique presentation, it's extremely difficult to take it apart. We always end up just throwing the entire lump of meat into the broth. 
- The staff is attentive, but can be a bit unorganized at times. 

Now that they've been opened for a while, be prepared for a bit of a wait.
author: Tiffany U.

description: Took my boyfriend here to try the all you can eat hot pot. It was $28.99 per person and includes unlimited sodas and desserts at the end. I love how they have a cute buffet section where you get to choose the ingredients to put in your hot pot. I think they can have a wider selection if they are trying to charge you almost $30. Like they could have crab legs with the shells, crawfish or other items included. Their sauce station was the simple sauces like soy sauce, ponzu, and garlic, etc. I think they can offer more sauce options as well. You order the meat at the table from your server. My boyfriend and I loved the ribeye the best. At the end we tried the watermelon dessert and the green tea ice cream. Would have to say the watermelon dessert was our favorite. We enjoyed this all you can eat place but I think there are still improvements this place can make.
author: Donna P.

description:
Followed the yelp reviews to the newly opened Fiery Hot Pot Buffet. We made reservations and when we arrived they had out table reserved for us. Business is already brisk with people waiting. The new decor with plenty of big screen TV's allowed us to watch the Ol'Miss and Florida St. football game along with some Japanese MV's. This is how it rates:

Decor and Ambience 5 stars
Presentation of food 5 Stars
Hot Pot Broths 4 stars 
Hot Pot food items 4 stars 
Price 4 stars $28 per 
Functionality 2 stars small tables with a huge induction cook top in the middle left little room for food dishes. Along with the huge raised cook top and the pot was suited for tall people but made conversation inconvenient. Hard chairs. 
Service 5 stars was friendly and efficient.
Parking and location 2.5 stars street parking in a hard to find area.

Bottom line nice hot pot restaurant, but I don't think I would venture all the way out to the outskirts of Taraval St. while there are plenty of good Hot Pot closer in San Francisco, unless I was in that area.
author: George F.

description:
Had dinner with an old girlfriend I haven't seen in forever. We both love hot pot, so when looking around for places to meet up for dinner, I suggested Fiery Hot Pot Buffet. We stopped by Monday, August 22nd at 6:15pm. Not sure if they take reservations, but we didn't have one. It was pretty slow, so it was easy to grab a table. No wait at all.

I love All You Can Eat, even if I don't really take advantage of it. The AYCE here includes bottomless soda. $27.99 for adults, $13.99 for children under 10 years, and Free for kids under 3 years. If you want to add All You Can Drink, it's an extra $7 for draft beer and hot or cold sake. We of course opted for the AYCD option as well. We did many, many hot sakes and a pitcher of Asahi. They also give you edamame when you sit down.

The difference with Fiery Hot Pot Buffet is they have a sauce, veggie, sides, seafood, etc, bar. So all you really need to order are the meats. This is great as sometimes AYCE places can lag while waiting for the servers to bring out the food. For our broth, we did a split pot with Rich Pork and Fiery Spice Beef. Other broths they offer are: Rich Roast Beef, Rice-less Porridge, Vegetarian Miso.

*Sauce bar: Ponzu, Hoisin, Chili, Beancurd, Barbecue, Sesame, Chili pepper, Garlic, Green onion, Cilantro, Soy
*Seafood/Sides: Seaweed salad, Tomato, Imitation crab stick, Quail eggs, Spam, Spicy sausages, Shrimp, Mussels, Fish ball with roe, Beef tendon, Cooked clam, Beef tripe, Pork sausages, Combination meat & fish balls
*Vegetables: Spinach, Tong ho, Enoki, Baby bok choy, Romaine lettuce, Watercress
*Noodles/Sides: Daikon radish, Fried tofu, Yam noodle, Wintermelon, Corn, Taro, Tofu, Broccoli, Pumpkin, Rice cake, Woodear, Vermicelli, Udon, Napa cabbage, Mung bean noodle

You can also get a raw egg or sides of rice if you ask for it. I love adding a raw egg yolk to my sauce, so of course I asked for an egg. I just keep my sauce simple: ponzu, soy, garlic, chili, green onions, and cilantro. Perfect for dipping.

We actually stayed light on sides. Grabbed mussels, fish ball with roe, tripe, spinach, enoki, corn, yam noodles, and maybe a couple other things I can't remember. The size of the dishes is actually perfect for sharing between two people as it's not too much. I loved putting everything in the spicy broth. I especially enjoyed the tripe and the fish balls filled with roe. My fav veggies were the spinach and enoki mushrooms.

For the meats, we started with one plate each of the Ribeye and Supreme beef. The Ribeye ended up being the best, so we stuck with that one and ordered another plate. The supreme beef was a little stringy and tough. The ribeye was more tender. The other dishes you can order are: Tender chicken breast, Premium lamb shoulder, Pork belly, Premium pork shoulder, Fillet-of-sole, Housemade dumpling.

Service was excellent! My gf and I were catching up, A LOT. So he was very sweet as we asked for refill after refill of sake. We actually didn't really eat much since we drank so much. At least we took advantage of the AYCD?

So glad I found this place. I do look forward to coming back and actually eating. Gotta take advantage of that AYCE as well!
author: Elena N.

description:
Sometimes you (I) get cravings for some hot pot or shabu. There's a difference, people!! But Fiery is definitely one of my favorite hotpot restaurants and I've told many people about it! The selection of meat is standard with a few additions such as dumplings! You make your own sauce at their sauce bar and grab your veggies, noodles and other proteins in that area. They have a great assortment of types of mushrooms, noodles, and greens. This is really what sets it apart from others I've been to. 

The service is pretty friendly and attentive. Your meal also comes with all the soda you can drink. I don't drink soda very often, but I'll have a glass here just because I might as well! I love this place because it's good for carnivores such as myself, but also herbivores like many people I know. We all win!!
author: Aaron Y.

description:
I was worried because of the review about the service, but I loved it here. With that being said, we arrived right when they opened @ 5pm and we were the third ones to be seated, so it wasn't as busy as others have mentioned.

The buffet was amazing, the bar was beautiful and the variety was seriously endless. The food presentation was definitely on POINT. The waiter was kind and they tended to us whenever we needed. (Although, again, I must mention that it wasn't as busy and we came right when they opened)

Soup Bases: Regular beef - star of the show and Spicy Fiery Beef in medium (way too spicy for us...shoot for the mild if you're not a spicy person)

Meat + Side dishes: We got supreme beef, rib eye beef, lamb shoulder, and pigs blood (yummy for chinese people). I personally don't like lamb as much, but the prime beef + rib eye beef were delicious. There were also plentiful of side dishes at the bar such as shrimp, wood ear, muscles, enoki, udon, ramen -- the list is endless. Check out the pics if you really want an idea of the whole list! The sauce bar was amazing as well, but of course I stuck to the usual, ponzo + garlic. But there are a lot of other choices like peanut sauce, hot sauce, etc. 

Drinks: We also received unlim drinks, soda + tea. :O

Dessert: We had a choice of grass jelly+ fruits or strawberry icecream at the end as well! We tried the grass jelly + fruits, it was okay, we were already too stuffed~

Love that there is parking around this area, and the decor of this place is cool too. Definitely coming back and I appreciated the kind waiters services!
author: Melanie T.

description:
Though I live in LA, my stomach will always belong to SF. And it's because of places like Fiery Hot Pot Buffet. 

All you can eat and drink
Excellent customer service
English speaking
Quality ingredients

Not many places offer all you can drink. Combine that with the excellent customer service from Pansy, not sure if she's the owner and or manager, but she kept the refills coming. I wonder if it's because if patrons are full on drink - they eat less.

Not in my case though. And the quality meats (see pics) as well as fish - came out when we were ready - the rest of the ingredients, was self serve. See pics again. The ingredients were fresh and they were kept stocked so no one was left waiting, wanting. I have to shamelessly admit, our table ate every meat and fish offered on the menu. 

Different broths available - you can even split the pot in half. We opted for Miso on one side and medium spicy on the other. The broths were full of flavor, even after several refills of hot water. The mixes complimented one another and I would definitely order the same combination again. 

The interior was modern and clean. As for parking, if you're familiar with the area, then you know what to expect. If you don't, all I will say is good luck. 

I really had an awesome experience here. Not just the company I dined with - but the quality of the food and service made for an unforgettable evening. I hope that this place does well because I hope to eat there again on my next visit to the Bay Area.
author: Randoll C.

description:
Went at 8pm. Saw four tables open. Needed table for two. No front person. But there was an iPad to put ur name in. Ten minutes later still not seated. Left. Will update review if I ever eat there. 

Cya.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Another new ownership? This place seems to keep changing whenever I visit. Not sure if its good or bad but I know this hot pot location has gone through several different names already. Employees are the same. Service is better. New look and uniforms. The only difference is they have a self serve area now where you make your own dipping sauces and you serve yourself on veggies, seafood and condiments.

Aside the rebranding and the self-service station. The taste is still good. I do like there were more people working to service us on the meats. I also like the idea of the self-servicing station where its all you can eat and get as much as you need or can eat. That just means the servers are paying more attention to customers who want more meat and drinks. 

Not sure why they rebranded as it has always had a lot of customers everytime I eat here. Either way I'll be returning as always as long as they dont change into a cafe of some sort lol.
author: Linda L.

description:
I have my own favorite hotpot place in San Gabriel Valley, but this place, makes my place in SGV "mediocre" in comparison. The first thing when you think buffet/AYCE is quality will suffer (because hey, it's obviously a large volume type of place) and the lack of customer service is expected (they employees normally are just going through the motions, again, due to the high number of patrons coming in and out). This place not only provides quality ingredients for a buffet, but the customer service is quite spectacular. Amazing how they can do it considering it was only Pansy (we believe the manager/owner?) and one other gentleman serving the place.

Beef/pork/fish/lamb is "controlled" by the house as you order accordingly what you like and they bring it to your table. It's not a problem because more than likely Pansy (who took care of us all night on our visit) made sure when we did run out (visually) of meat, she was there to ask right away, "You guys ready for more meat?". Same goes with our bottomless sodas, she would provide us with a new cup once the current one we were drinking was already half way. 

Once you're seated, you order your broth(s), they can do a whole pot or a split pot. We chose the Miso (good for vegetables) and spicy beef broth (we did it medium which had a nicely slight kick to it). Then you choose your protein(s). We ended up ordering all of the proteins on the menu that was available.

Rib-eye: it was nicely marbled, thinly sliced and didn't taste like it was frozen, nicely presented (reminded me of KBBQ) this was my favorite overall
Pork (Belly?): felt like bacon (sans being cured/smoked/salted) wasn't bad at all
Supreme Beef: tasted like regular beef (don't know if it was supposed to be seasoned?), but rib-eye to me was a better choice (rolled to look like a rose)
Lamb: wasn't as gamy to what lamb normally is, so it was decent (rolled to look like a rose)
Chicken: sliced thinly, was OK, but I prefer the others (rolled to look like a rose)
Sole: looked like sashimi, nice texture. Doesn't crumble like other places I've had fish in hotpot before. My second favorite "meat"
Blood cakes: subject to availability, was good, we basically used the ladle with the strainer to lightly blanch them. Doesn't really have its own flavor, so it soaks up whatever flavor you dip/heat it in

After you order your proteins, you can go to the ingredients bar that broken up into three "sections" (all in one area, but broken up).

I grabbed quail eggs, tripe, tendon, fish ball with the roe inside, fried tofu, woodear mushrooms, corn, lotus roots, large enokis. There are plenty of items to choose from, though lacking bamboo shoots and baby corn. The ingredients they have, were more than enough for me and my party. The other thing I noticed, they're all on top of cooling type bars (refer to my picture). 

Lastly, go to the condiments bar to mix/match your own type of sauces, green onions, soy sauce etc.

I really enjoyed my meal here, coupled with the quality ingredients and the amazing customer service. I can't wait to go back with more people. I just hope nothing changes from my visit to when I do visit again.

Dinner is $25ish tax/person, but that includes all you can eat hotpot, all you can drink soda (you can do all you can drink alcohol +$7/person, but the entire table has to do all you can drink), and dessert. Please take my money!!!

The only thing that was new to me (being from L.A.) when the trolley would go up and down Polk, the floor would shake a bit, but again, nothing that will keep me away from this place). Parking is also tricky, but worth looking for to eat at this place. My spot in SGV is lucky this place is in Northern California, otherwise this would be it.

After a disappointing dinner at another place we had high hopes for, my finacee was glad to "make up for it" by finding this place. Thank you as well Pansy and your staff for the amazing meal.
author: Wes S.

description: My fave hot pot place in the city. Servers are attentive and I like that you get your own sides. Dessert and drinks are included in the price.
author: Amanda T.

description: This is by far my favorite Hot Pot place. The service is always amazing with friendly people, especially a particular gentleman who works there, who's name I didn't catch. It's perfect if you don't like to wait because you only order the meats from the servers and everything else is conveniently placed at a buffet style bar, from seafood to noodles to veggies. They also have a make your own sauce section! So good and not badly priced for all you can eat and free refills on sodas. Highly recommend.
author: Karla C.

description: My husband and I enjoyed this place. We selected two different broths, the coconut curry, and the pork broth. The broth could have been a little more flavorful, but we were able to flavor it up with the variety of sauces. Great place, plentiful selection of meat and veggies, the decor was modern and set a good atmosphere.
author: Kristine X.

description:
New hotpot place that opened in place of G Cube. Outside looks small but upon entering, it's pretty spacious. Could fit maybe 40-50 people. Seats are pretty comfortable. All you can eat and includes unlimited refill soda.

On a Saturday, arrived around 5-6pm and it was empty. Closer to 7-8 that's when the crowds rolled in. Service was great. They were able to answer the questions thrown at them.
