They checked in from time to time and they speak Canto for the curious ones. I heard they were setting up a karaoke room in the back sooo...

You're allowed to do half-half for the pot. The broth I got was rich pork and it was pretty good. I liked the porky taste. My table had the supreme beef and ribeye. The ribeye was soooo good. The meat was soft and broke apart nicely after cooking. The supreme beef was good too. If you plan on cooking the whole thing, just toss it in; it will break apart itself in the cooking process. Otherwise, unwrap it. I forgot about it and left it in the pot a little too long, it didn't turn very chewy so that's good. You know it's good meat; fresh and tasty. I also liked their dumplings, which are made in house. 

If you want some seafood, go to the back where there's a small bar of fish balls, clams, mussels, spam, quail eggs, shrimp, etc. There are also veggies like broccoli, napa cabbage and tofu. They also have a variety of sauces in the back like ponzu, bbq, hoisin, sesame, etc. Everything is really fresh. Didn't see any bad foods or any left out for a long time.

Overall I think this place is pretty neat and worth a try. Although it is a bit pricey in my opinion ($28/adult, $14/child), it's all you can eat so can't complain.
author: Benita M.

description:
OMG this is now my favorite hot pot place in SF. Hubby and I got the beef and pork broth. Delicious! It is great getting items from the ingredient bar. We really enjoyed all the noodles, mushrooms, and the seaweed salad. Great service - they refilled our all you can drink drinks quickly. They took away plates as quickly as we could empty them. The Supreme Beef comes in a roll that will unravel in the broth. Beware the green sleeves that are inside! The clams are sandy, so we will stay away from them next time. Really enjoyed the sauce bar as well. They have ponzu sauce which was great for marinating mussels. 

Now you can add yourself to the wait list via Yelp! Definitely will be doing this going forward.
author: Lisa S.

description:
I didn't realize there were so many hot pots restaurants in the city. But this was fun I unfortunately came by myself totally worth it to share with somebody else for 2899 and $7 for a 22 oz Sapporo... Totally worth it! 
And delicious on top of it.
They give you this big silver pot and you get to choose two different kinds of broth. I went with coconut curry and a vegetable miso broth which I preferred over the coconut curry not that I did not like the coconut curry. Then you get one of each of these items : Supreme beef, ribeye, premium lamb, filet of sole, pork belly, and tender chicken breast. And actually tonight they we're trying out the wagyu beef. You can try out wagyu beef on me anytime! I only ordered one each of supreme beef, ribeye, premium lamb, and filet of sole, and of course the wagyu beef. 
And that's not all! All of that includes a buffet of more food! I took some shrimp, mussels, Lobster balls, and a seaweed salad. There was all kinds of things on that Buffet like tofu, quail eggs, spam!, clams, tripe, all kinds of stuff!
And that's not all! Lol they give you a dessert. The choice tonight was either a shot of watermelon soku or some black cherry ice cream that shows the ice cream and it was delicious!
The best $40 plus some cash chip I ever spent in my entire life! Well definitely in the top 10
Minus 1 star for not letting me take my leftovers home
author: Erin L.

description: Great food and service! It was my first time here and is very similar to Korean style buffets. You get a pot of broth that you heat to a boil on the center of the table and cook your food in the broth! It's a nice environment and the staff was helpful. Parking was along the street and easy in the later part of the day. This place is a 5 out 5. The food was great! They had a variety of meats and seafood.
author: fabian c.

description: The food is great, and what made it even better was the service.  They constantly clear off the small dishes that the food comes on, which allows them to check on your drinks.  You don't have to ask for refills as they just do it seeing your cup is low.  All you need to do is enjoy the food.
author: Desmond C.

description:
Finally found another AYCE hot pot! I had to venture away from Irving (heaven forbid) to try this place out. I was definitely skeptical at first when I called and found out there was no wait. BUT only a half hour after I called, there was a pretty significant wait (probably about 20-3min) for two people. 

I definitely liked that there was a self-serve area for non-sliced meats, veggies, sauce, and other items. Also, soft drinks are included in the price as well! There's an option for AYCD as well, but I'll save that for another time. The items in this area were changed pretty frequently as I went to grab veggies and other items frequently and always saw someone adding and removing items.

When we ordered meat, it came out pretty quickly and it was presented in such a pretty way! I was literally given a bowl with roses made of sliced meat. The staff were very kind and attentive, but it was so busy that night that they didn't check on us too frequently (also, we had large parties to both sides of us). Parking can be a pain, but we found that there was ample parking near the Taraval Police Station and the park the block up; it's definitely a small walk, but it's worth it when you're that full.


Food: 8/10
Staff: 8/10
Atmosphere: 8/10
Value: 8/10
Overall: 8/10
author: Evan K.

description:
I was skeptical to try this place at first, but I've become a fan! 
We came at around 7:30, parked took a little while, it really depends. But if you go down towards Ulloa it should be fine lol. No wait! We got seated after 5 min of them prepping a table. 

The place is not too big itself. What I love about Fiery Hot Pot are the meats. They are so fresh and tender. The supreme beef was my fave. I like how you can pick your own veggies, noodles, etc. without having to wait to get them. I personally think the items were fresh, and they were often interchanged so I dont believe they were sitting out for too long. I wish there were more items/variety but it's a pretty good/basic selection for hot pot.  Sauce bar was good. Sesame sauce tasted a little like peanut butter, so wasn't too much of a fan of that. But ponzu was great! 

We got the miso and the spicy pork broth. I'm sensitive to spice & the spicy pork broth wasn't too bad. You can also customize how spicy you want the base to be. 

Customer service was also great! Very attentive and offered suggestions. Always took away finished plates immediately & fast on refills.
author: Kathleen A.

description: Great place for all you can eat. 28.99 for all u can eay with wagyu beef (yumm) and add $10 for all u can drink. Good beers and hot sake. So cheers to them sake bombs. Food is very good and service is very good too. Good selections on sauces for flavours and condiments and greens. Chill place woth decent music and super casual. Highly recommend. Coming from a foodie a big thumbs up.
author: Kunwar R.

description:
I was skeptical of another hot pot place opening in the bay area because it's saturated with hot pot spots already.  I wanted to see how this place measured up to the others and whether it's worth it to go. The set up is similar to Sea Pot (albeit the conveyor belt) where the veggies, fish balls, etc are laid out. You will need to order the meat via the server though. I appreciate that they're in tiny containers/plates so that you can portion yourself and try as many things as you'd like. Standard fare of various hotpot things. 

There's a sauce bar where you can make your own sauce. The hot pot utilizes induction heat. The place is decently sized. Our group had went on a weekday and there wasn't a wait. However, your party will not be seated unless your entire party is present. 

The best part is the broth. We ordered the spicy rich pork and the rich beef broth. The broth is exactly like its name.. it's rich! (Not the layers and layers of oil but dense in flavor.) For dessert, we were served watermelon sago in a shot glass!

The service could be a bit more attentive (we asked twice for water..and more than once for other things). However, they were super chill when our group asked them to take a picture for us.

Overall, I would return!
author: Jay Z.

description: One of my all time favorite hot pot places! The meats are very fresh and high quality. I personally recommend the rib eye and lamb. There are a variety of different seafood sides, veggies, and sauces. Also, their watermelon sago and match ice cream also comes with the $29 buffet meal. This place did not disappoint.
author: Carrie L.

description: The meat and the selection of toppings were great, however the broth was kinda weird. It was very thick and it smelled funny. The service was good and the decoration was modern, nice, and clean. However, for the price though, it did not meet my expectation if they charge us that much and not have a lot of seafood and stuffs.
author: Claire H.

description:
Probably one of my favorite hotpot place for now. Made a reservation for 8 people and were accommodated immediately upon arrival. We chose the spicy and pork bone broth for both pots. I couldn't stop eating the rib eye and supreme beef. The meat remained so tender after the cook that I immediately knew it was quality beef. Lamb and pork belly was also a running up great selection. I liked the presentation of the self served mini plates of vegetables, clams, mussels, fish & beef balls, etc. The self served sauce station had all the staple hotpot sauces like soy sauce, chili oil, cilantro, garlic, etc... 

Something that was a plus, was it was unlimited soda with the All you can eat deal. That is something that probably makes them stand out from most hotpot places who charge individually. The server was also great in providing excellent service. Ended with the complimentary dessert of lychee ice cream and red bean ice cream. Andes mint chocolates were also provided when paying. 

Overall, grade A meat quality and service. Will have to make a trip back here sometime soon.
author: Auden W.

description:
My favorite hotpot with all uou can eat meat menu option, everyone in our 8 person, 4 different broths was happy. We set up for "spicy" lovers at one end of table plus veggies, noodles are at a buffet so you can choose what you want to eat. There is a generous . variety of condiments Flavors are a mix of chinese, japanese, Korean ingredients and flavors.

My Dad commented several times during the meal how much he enjoyed it. Couldn't do this at home AND pleasr every palate.

Close to home and takes reservations - - - be sure to make reservations.
author: Audrey R.

description: We came here for our anniversary on a weekday evening. Surprisingly, the tables were almost full which is a good sign indicating they've got good business there. The restaurant has nice modern decor and the bathroom is clean and well maintained. We ordered the miso and pork  broth which came quickly within 5 min. The deserts are definitely good treats. Staff there seemed to be nice and paid a lot of attention on their customers. It can be a bit pricy for families with 4 or more people dinning there.
author: Sarah H.

description: 1.5hr time limit to eat. Sauce bar is extensive. Food options come in little plates that you pick up yourself. Meats are provided by the servers. Unlimited soda refills. Desserts available upon request (jelly or ice cream). Pots accommodate two soups. They should have more dumpling varieties.
author: W A.

description: Trash service. There were at least 5 parties waiting. At the top of the list was a party of 5 and there was a huge table open but didn't seat them for over 20 minutes which held back all the groups behind them. Then another group left and they waited another 15 minutes to just clean the table to let the next party sit. After waiting over an hour, we just left. Definitely not worth it - no efficiency.
author: Jay C.

description: Food is great! Service is impeccably attentive yet not overwhelming. The staff has a great attitude.
author: Andrea H.

description:
I stopped by here on a SATURDAY NIGHT for a birthday dinner after coming across it on yelp. I had zero to no expectations coming in and was simply eager to check this place out. 

They DO NOT take same day reservations (but this may vary depending on the night possibly) however, they will kindly put your name down on a waitlist. So I strongly suggest calling in and asking beforehand! & to be safe, come in before 7pm!! (Aka crazy dinner rush time). 

THE SERVICE:
The staffs were extremely kind and constantly stopping by to check on our table! That doesn't happen too often at pot hot style restaurants. And even when there were a few people waiting to be seated, the environment was very calm, spacious, and I never felt rushed! WIN!

THE FOOD:
All of the raw pork and beef needs to be ordered by the server and they bring it out to you. Then theres a bar buffet section that offers a wide variety of dishes such as tofu, mushroom, noodles, veggies (eat your veggies!!) and ect. Every thing looked and tasted fresh!

ORDER THE HOUSE MADE DUMPLINGS!! underrated on the menu but soooooo tasty!!

I would def be back one day! Its a nice experience once in a while if you're craving hot pot, lazy to make it yourself at home, or if it was recently pay day. HEH.
author: Mary L.

description:
I've never seen such attentive staff at a Chinese restaurant, let alone an all you can eat hotpot joint. Meat came out promptly, waters were always filled, and service was great.

I like the idea of having everything but the meat be self-serve -- cuts down on wait times and ensures that you get to try a little bit of everything that you want.

The beef isn't the most well-marbled, but it was still pretty decent, and appeared to be very fresh.

Best of all... we were able to walk-in and get a table without a wait!
author: Kazu O.

description:
I'm from Los Angeles and I have tried a bunch of hot pot places, but rarely from an ayce hotpot. This is one of three places I have tried that is ayce and out of every hot pot places (both non-ayce and ayce) I have had, this is at the top of the list. Considering the choices that Los Angeles has. They also have bottomless refill of soda !

Honestly, the price seemed pricey at first but after eating here, the price seems reasonable. They have a lot of choices in selection for veggies, noodles, and meat. They are all prepared already, so you just grab the container of what you want.

Service is good as well. The staff speaks Cantonese and Mandarin. They are super friendly. They also help my friend and I translate some food items from English to Mandarin/Cantonese!

The ambiance here is calm. Not too loud and not too quiet. It's very very clean. They can also split the check three way max! Will most definitely come back when I visit!
author: Angellynn T.

description:
I've been here twice, and I think I've found my new favorite hotpot place. Bonus points for being in my neighborhood. I used to be a frequent patron of Hot Pot Garden before it burned down, but it was always so busy and the wait so long to get a table. Secretly crossing my fingers that Fiery Hotpot remains a hush-hush neighborhood secret gem so wait times can remain fast! I came at opening time on a weekend and there was no wait until later in the evening when groups started coming in.

The price is very reasonable for AYCE hotpot AND it includes free soda + refills and a complimentary dessert at the end, assuming you have the stomach space left. Their sauce station and small seafood/veggie buffet station is my favorite part. You can grab small bowls of a wide variety of hot pot staples like shrimp, fish balls, clams, mussels, etc., and vegetarian options such as tong hao, spinach, mushrooms and more. Also I LOVE that their sauce station includes sesame sauce and satay sauce. They have even ponzu and fermented tofu sauce, and very fresh herbs for your dip. You can choose to create your own sauce to be more Chinese style, Japanese style, SE Asian style, etc..

Their meat is also exceptionally fresh. I am typically a ribeye fan but their supreme beef is very good also. Service is great and they are always refilling your pot and drinks when running low.
author: Melody S.

description:
Probably the friendliest staff I've ever seen at a Chinese restaurant.  They're super attentive -- constantly refilling waters, taking away plates, and bring over meats.  Here you order the meat through the server and everything else is self serve.  It's AYCE and that includes soda and dessert.  

The beef isn't super well marbled, but it's pretty good.  My only issue with it is that it's often served to us slightly frozen.  I also wish they had more regular broth flavors. Like porridge broth without the rice?  What does that mean? Is that just like chicken broth?  

Best part...we walked in and got seated right away. No wait, and it was a super cold night! We'll be coming back soon!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Great spot! Love the selection of veggies, meat and that it comes with great service. Will be back!
author: Nicolas G.

description: Stopped by this place after a long day of being out and it was exactly what we needed! They have a topping station kinda thing, so you just pick up whatever you want and bring it back to your table to cook. You order the meat from the servers but that makes complete sense lol. It wasn't very crowded the day we came in, there was probably two other tables there, parking was also easy but I can see how it could get a little hectic over the weekend. The broths were pretty standard, we got the miso and the beef broth.. both were good but the beef got a little oily and a lot thicker over time. I have no major complaints, not the best I've ever had but I would definitely come back.
author: Leanna U.

description: I love their service here!!! The servers working kept coming around to refill our pots with more broth and always asked if we wanted to order more meat, which is unlimited by the way! All of their add-ons are unlimited, too, which you just walk up and grab.  They have all your typical hot pot add ons: veggies, tofu, fish balls, noodles, etc. but the way they present it and plate it is so aesthetically pleasing. I took a photo of it and so many people asked where I was eating LOL
author: Jay P.

description:
The meat quality is top notch. They have almost everything at the buffet bar, so you can get as much as you want without going through the waiter. 

There's a bunch of seafood. I'm a fan of clams and mussels.


Customer service is the the best I've experienced at any hotpot buffet. Not only do they never stinge, and always bring you exactly what you order promptly, they will never leave you either low soup, or low water, and will actively come ask you when you run out of meat if you want to order more.

Is this some awesome parallel universe? Definitely my favorite hotpot place.
author: Emma T.

description: This place was pretty good. The sign in feature on yelp helps avoid long wait times! Not too expensive either! Our waitress was indeed nice and explained everything thoroughly! Will be back again :)
author: Shamal L.

description:
Been living in China for the past two years and was sad to see G Cube was no longer here! But I love hot pot, so nothing could keep me away from trying out this place. 

Really liked the supreme beef and ribeye. Only complaint about the ribeye is its difficult to pull it apart because they serve it as one pile of meat. Still very tasty though. Both meats are very fresh and tender. I think the only difference between the two is that supreme beef is a bit thicker. Anyways, do yourself a favor and order both - you won't regret it! 

Definitely looking forward to coming back here!
author: Nicole Y.

description:
$28 for AYCE... it comes with a free soda which I love when eating hot pot to balance out the salt in the soups. This place is cool because you can order meats with your server and go to the counter to help yourselves to veggies, seafood, and other side items. I like how they do that because you can see it before you get what you want to eat and the portions are smaller in case you just want a little bit of it. There is also a sauce bar as well. We got one of the spicy ones and a chinese herb one as our soup base and it was pretty good. The meat and veggies were pretty good/fresh for the most part. My fave was the lamb and their beef.

Overall, decent and fun place to come get some hot pot.
author: Sophia Y.

description: Love this place. Always plenty to eat even without meat choices. Sauce bar is the best of all the hot pot places I've been to. Totally recommend it. Go early like as soon as they open otherwise place fills up fast...
author: L D.

description: This is the worse hot pot all you can eat place ever. First of all, this place is Way overpriced and horrible service. Meat /food quality is only average. For $35/person including tip and tax, we could have chosen another better hot place in the city. Services was extremely terrible and horrible, this waitress- the guy really acts like he's the owner wanting to make sure customer are eating too much so he could make more business . But I don't think he's the owner bc he was also wearing uniform like others. If could leave zero star, i could have given zero star. It was a stressful AYCE experience, we were told we would be charged extra at our first order when we only requesting 2 dishes of meats, fine was thinking it must be big portion each order. Came out to be smaller portion. When we were done we asked to order for 2nd time ,then same guy, this guy asked if we want to order half order they can do that? What? Did I hear him right? Half order for the 2 time we ordered meat? Isn't it a AYCE place? Why we were so afraid of ordering and being rejected each time? Me and hubby cAme with our baby and we were barely eating at all. We were very stressful eating there the WHOLe Time, afraid of being criticized for ordering more food. We left the place with empty stomach. The 2 female waitress are nicer at least will come collect dirty dishes when w asked .when asked to refill soda, this same guy pretend didn't see us. What a experience! Service was horrible staff really need to have better training and attitude. This guy deserve zero tip! Sound fear? We put down tip for these two waitress they were nice and provide better customers service. There r tons of AYCE hot pot place why am I returning to eat at this ridiculous stressful place?
author: Joanne L.

description: This place was "a-ok" because there was not too too much that stood out about them compared to other AYCE hot pot places. Their broth was ok (not too too much flavor) and the area where all the food is kept didn't seem too sanitary since they keep the ingredients in bowls (they also keep the ingredients in open bowls in the fridge already prepped). When we walked into the restaurant the staff just stared and didn't acknowledge or seat us until 10 mins after (there was about 8 tables open). I thought they hadn't seen and was about to suggest to my boyfriend that we leave but the waiter caught up.
author: Monica L.

description:
The store is small, but service and food selection is very good. 

We went as a party of 4, waited about 2 hours with 12 parties ahead of us, but the wait was worthwhile. They have unlimited sodas, a good sauce bar, and visually pleasing vegetable/seafood options that you can grab on your own. Not ALOT of meats to choose from like other AYCE hot pot places, but we basically just ordered the Prime Cut and Wagyu many times. 

Wish the place was bigger, but it is a very stylish looking place. Service could be better, but I don't blame them as it's very popular. One of the best places in SF to have AYCE hot pot with friends if you don't mind a potentially long wait. 

Also, they have optional spicy level for the spicy soup bases. Extra points!
author: Niro K.

description:
I'm not sure who wrote the other 12 reviews that are preceding mine (all 5 stars) but this place def. is NOT a 5 star. They need to get their operations together ASAP if they wanna succeed in this competitive hot pot market in SF.

Timeline:
Called and made a 'reservation' per their advertisement on yelp.

Got here and 30 mins later, we got sat but that wasn't the part I was so extremely pissed at. There were at least five open tables that was just empty as they made multiple parties wait. The table in front of me was wiped SIX times before they decided to seat a table 45 mins later. We were super confused.

Anyways, it took another 30 mins to get a menu (A MENU!!!!) and then took another 15 mins to get the soup and then 10 mins for the beef. At this time, I was about to leave but given that we've already invested 1+ hour here, I figured we should just try it bc maybe the food will make up for it?

We didn't get any spoons/utensils/tongs until we asked after the food got to the table.

Free soda with ayce? That's great except we had to ask three different people before we got a refill  still really confused at this point.

The beef was ok, not bad. The variety was decent but then they ran outta fish balls with roe, watercress, Napa cabbage and at this point, I gave up.

I don't think the staff is incompetent or is malicious but I really just don't think they have it together - there are at least three people behind the counters at any given time and they're pouring drinks or grabbing meats and running back and forth. Some tips to improve is just to have a sign up sheet in the front so the hostess isn't running back and forth and then forgetting to help current customers who have sat down. Just have one or two people focused on actual customer service (pouring soup/drinks/putting in new items) and have 1-2 servers be the actual food runners. Oh another pro tip - just put freaking menus on the table when people sit 

I'd be willing to come back in a few months and by then hopefully my review will change bc they would have figured it out.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Went on a weekday and got a seat right away. I was confused why there wasn't a line, because this is one of the best hotpot places I ever had! They had a buffet style section where you can grab and go. My favorite base for the pots is the curry. The waiters are super friendly and the service was quick. Ambiance is cozy and inviting. They even gave us pineapple ice cream and watermelon sago at the end. The only downside was that it was 30 bucks, but it's totally worth it!
author: Kendrick K.

description:
AYCE & AYCD? I'm in!

2 friends and I decided to give this place a try after reading such amazing reviews. We came on a Sunday night around 6pm & was seated right away. We all decided to do both AYCE (27.99) and AYCD (+$7). The service was awesome - people constantly came over to our table to ask if we needed anything and to clean off empty plates. 

You order only the soup, drinks & meat with them, but everything else (vegetables, noodles, frozen seafood) you get on your own, which is really convenient, so you don't need to wait for them to bring you anything. I also noticed that everytime I walk up to get more, it's ALWAYS filled - they do a really good job looking at what's running low & fast to fill up.

Another plus is their sauce bar! If you're anything like me, I love a good sauce - and they had it all! All the essentials to a delicious sauce (soy sauce, garlic, cilantro, green onions, hot sauce, jalepenos, and more!). 

The one thing preventing me from giving them that extra star is the price. I usually don't eat enough to feel good about the AYCE option, so this one definitely hurt a little. Definitely to come once in awhile with friends if you're feeling extra hungry!
author: Carrie L.

description:
Ive tried Hotpot Garden when it was around, iPot, The Pots, and some other places in Richmond. 

This is my favorite spot even when it was G-Cube. Fresh meat, decent price, free soda, comes with ice cream/dessert and most of all service was great. Quick waiter response which I think is important. Not super loud like the other places which was also a plus. 

The Fiery Curry is really good. Not all hotpot places have it. Its so flavorful that you might not even need additional sauces on your meat.
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
Another Hot Pot spot to try!  Came out here on a Thursday and it seemed relatively quiet around 7:30, but picked up soon after.  We got seated quickly and they let us wait for a couple of people before starting timer.  The place itself is set up nice, although a little small.  They have the veggies and sides portioned out  and placed in the back corner.  A small sauce bar is there as well.  

The ingredients were fresh, especially the veggies.   They serve the meat to you three options at a time, which doesn't sound so bad until you realize the portions are kinds small (here giving up quantity for presentation).  The meats were tasty tho.  The broth was good as well, but not outstanding.   

I think the biggest issue I have is the buffet style bar, which although allows you to get what you want when you want, you are constantly getting up to get more.  Kinda ruins the flow of the table.  I'd rather just ask or more stuff and continue with my conversations.

Over all I still had a good time and the staff was friendly and accommodating.  Might come back, but its sooooooo far out.
author: Veasna H.

description:
Summary:
- Service 1/5
- Food & Sauces 4/5

Pricing:
- AYCE + Bottomless Soda = $28
- AYCE + Bottomless Beer & Sake = $36
- 18% gratuity for groups of 6 and up

Got lucky and reserved a table over the phone and got to the restaurant 20 mins later to get seated. Unfortunately, it basically went downhill from there. 

- Right when we stepped in there were a few different groups inside the door but only one group had seen the sign-in sheet. Apparently a lady who worked there had it but she was in the back of the restaurant occupied and it was 10 mins until my boyfriend went to remind them about our table. She said they just had to set it before we got seated.
- Although our table was clean when we got there (we had a table for 9 so we knew it was ours), it took 20 MINS for them to actually set it with plates and chopsticks and seat us. 
- It took us almost 30 MINS AFTER THAT just to get our broth aka we got our broth about an hour after we got to the restaurant when we had a reservation. 
- Our waiter messed up on our drinks. We ordered mostly sodas...got mostly waters and had to remind him about the sodas. 
- The meat selection is okay but the meat comes out in such small bowls that you have to keep reordering and of course the meat takes a while to come so there's lots of waiting. 
- What's different is that they have a sauce bar and a bar with all the non-meat sides (veggies, noodles, seafood). There are many different sauces to choose from and you can pick up the veggies, seafood, and noodles whenever you want.
- You can have two different soups for no charge.
- They offer dessert which is nice but they'll say they have strawberry ice cream and grass jelly and we thought they had grass jelly ice cream but it's really just grass jelly fyi haha. 

I think they were just really understaffed and just need to get their act together. AYCE hot pot is all about the service and getting food as fast as possible so hopefully they hire more people so customers aren't just waiting around.
author: Amanda L.

description: Found this place through a Vlog and had to come try it out for myself. We got there pretty late, hr before closing, but the staff was very accommodating and letting us stay past closing time. Meats were fresh, I liked how they display all the additional hot pot items up on the counter so you can grab whatever you like. Place was clean, service was good, would certainly come back again.
author: Matthew L.

description: My friends and I got the rich roast beef and spicy soup. We asked for extra spicy and the soup isnt spicy but they just increase the mala taste in it. It hella numbed our tongues and did not give me that hint of spicy I was looking for... As for the meat, it's fresh and tender. As for the food that was laid out, I question how long it was out there. The restaurant definitely looks clean  and service is 6 stars. They were on point. Seriously. Oh, bonus point- soda is free! They would give you a new cup of soda before you even finish yours. Once they see an empty plate, they will clear it off fast and if you are low on meat they will ask if you want to order more. This hot pot place is average. Nothing too special about it. I would come again, if they made some changes to the soup.
author: Darlene T.

description:
Definitely make reservations as the place is not that large. It is nice to be able to walk right in and get seated when there is a wait for tables. 

I liked the self serve concept for the veggies, seafood, noodles and sauces. I was pleasantly surprised how the servers would always ask if we wanted another plate of meat when they came by to pick up the empty plate. 

Free soda was included which was a nice bonus.
author: Susan L.

description:
DID I JUST DIE & GO TO HOTPOT HEAVEN?!?!??

I'm not exaggerating guys. I've been to so many hotpot places and even hotpot places in Hong Kong.... Fiery Hotpot is seriously doing something right. From the amazing spicy mala beef broth to the amazingly clean display of side dishes, it's so delicious here.

Fiery is located where G-Cube was originally but don't be fooled because the place actually can set 40-50 people. The space is really open and is so clean and well decorated. You are greeted with edamame immediately and head to the sauce and sides station!!!

The sides are prepped and displayed really nice and clean so it makes it really appetizing to grab. Unlike some hotpot places where you know in he back of your mind it's probably been prepped in a really gross Chinese kitchen. GUYS I CANT RAVE ENOUGH ABOUT THIS PLACE.

P.S. There also ice cream bro, ugh. Can I just marry this place?!?!
author: Kary Y.

description:
This is the second time my review was taken down because it didn't "fall into guidelines"... Let's face it, this place is desperate to have high ratings without a dissenting opinion that their service lacks common sense and their side bar of veggies are old and dry. 
They refused to seat us even though there was 1 other customer there; the place was dead... We were missing 1 from a big group of 6, I think u can bend if there's NO one there.  
Though my list of complaints proceeds with how the manager or owner explained SLOWLY how Hotpot works there when it ate sufficiently into our 1.5 hour and we know how AYCE Hotpot works, it's nothing new. So we were left with 15 minutes less, not including the time to bring out the soups, subtract another 10-15minutes, thus, an hour or less. 

Please stop removing my review as it pertains to the lacking experience and rudeness my whole group had there. Bad move when we are big ol' foodies that eat out a lot... Why would you be rude and inconsiderate to customers in an empty place by making us stand by the  freezing door when, , should had just seated us and get our water  and order started at Least, unless that's your business tactic to lessen eating time.
author: Miss J.

description:
No reservation on the same day? Join the waiting list on their Facebook page? Are you kidding me? I used to like this place before I discovered Lollipop. Choice was pretty good, not perfect, but just pretty good.
Thanks to their policy and just OK food, I managed to try other hot pot places, better hotpot places, better than Lollipop... They must believe that they think they are God's gift, by being in the Top10 from an unknown web site and unknown writer.. Woohoo!
author: Jean-Yves F.

description: Always hits the spot.  Love the individual containers. Employees friendly and kept checking with us if we needed additional meat, soup and clearing empty dishes.
author: Deanna L.

description:
Originally we were going to Ipot but their wait was too long so I decided to go on yelp and checked what was around. Came across Fiery hot pot and notice they just opened not too long ago. 

Customer service was awesome, hostess introduced the menu to us acknowledging that it was our first time. Menu is very simple, all you can eat hot pot $27.99. Had a handful of housemade broth, meat selection is a little narrow but they were definitely good. Cool thing is they had a mini buffet area with unlimited visits of veggies, noodles, and seafood. Definitely coming back!
author: Angela L.

description:
I really liked the ambience here. It wasn't very crowded, yes maybe because it hasn't really gotten very known yet, and all the employees were so kind. Meat is to order with a worker, and everything else is buffet style! 
The spicy broth is most definitely more spicy in comparison to other hot pot places I've tried, so beware if you were think it's mild! 
To top the meal off, you are given two choices of red bean ice cream or grass jelly with mixed fruit. 
I don't think the grass jelly should be an option. They should probably consider getting another brand because it tasted pretty bad. However the red bean ice cream was really good!! 

I would definitely come back!
author: Tricia T.

description:
Great new hotpot place replaced G Cube!! High quality Chinese hotpot! Very comfortable and trendy environment! Nice and fresh vegetables! I've tried the spicy beef soup base and congee soup base which was wonderful! MUST TRY their beef soup base!! Best beef soup base I've ever had among the Bay Area hotpot restaurants, so rich! : D  Beef and fish were perfectly cut! Leo and Pansy were very friendly and helpful! Yes! Their restroom is clean!! (Again! Clean restroom in a restaurant is always a matter for me !! :D) Also, another MUST TRY if you like some alcohol, Yogurt Soju!! Fiery became my favorite hotpot place on my hotpot restaurant list now!! :D

PS: PokeStop next to it!!
author: Katherine L.

description: any AMAZING hot pot spot.  It is a buffet style hot pot with all you can eat meat, shrimp, mussels, veggies, noodles, and soda!  The staff are super nice and are attentive to your needs.  They clean off your tables quickly and try to make as much room as they can for you to get more food.  They also include a really nice dessert at the end (I got the watermelon sago).  I loved the environment although it is in a more quiet neighborhood.  The staff are fully capable of helping you and they legit will try to do anything to help.  They automatically refilled my drink and it was really nice.  Also, they are super caring so if you ever accidentally burn yourself,  you're in good hands haha... (@myself)
author: Rita C.

description:
After chillaxin at the Marina Green on a beautiful sunny day in SF, hanging with firefighters on their boat, watching the Blue Angels perform fancy tricks, and looking confuzzled AF while my friends played Monopoly Deal, I met up my GFs for dinner.  Fiery use to be GCube, one of my favorite shabu places; still shabu but slightly different concept.  

There's a section in the corner where all the sides and sauce are self serve.  They roll up the lamb and supreme beef into pretty flowers which is cool for looks but it was difficult to unravel.  Like bro, I just want my meat neatly plated on a dish easily accessible to grab and dip.  Service is great.  Our server was SUPER polite; such a kind soul.  I would've given 5 stars but I thought the Ribeye was okay.  I only eat beef went shabuing and the meat here wasn't satisfying.

We did a lot of damage killing a lot of the side plates but didn't stuff ourselves with meat...perhaps saving that for-- yeah nevermind.  Overall, good food, good company.  Love hanging with my girls literally LOLing so hard, I tinkled a bit.  Don't judge me.
author: Linda N.

description: Love that the non-meat items (noodles, veggies, sauces) are self serve and all laid out in smaller portions in a very clean, open space. Some confusion when ordering dessert for our group of 6, as not all pots were done eating and some wanted to move on to sweets. Great hot spot option overall.
author: Rebecca R.

description: Love the unique selection of hot pot items (tendon, seafood) that Fiery has. There can be quite a wait so be sure to check in on the wait list on yelp. Plenty of seating and TVs if you wanna catch a game. Staff was friendly and very attentive. Will be back!
author: Christopher W.

description: This place is cozy. Broth is flavorful. Fast, friendly and attentive servers. Totally recommend this place.
author: Derek L.

description:
This place has amazing food and the service is phenomenal! Neil is the best server in the world and  makes our night as soon as we walk in. Definitely need to check this place out! It's the shabu gem of the sunset!!!!!!

Source - locals who go here once a week!

Ps - hey Fiery! Thanks for being so cordial - keep on being you. You're perfect.
author: Pete C.

description:
It's 28$ per person, including soda. At the end you can get either this honeydew desert or lychee ice cream. 

What I really liked was the Rib Eye and the dumplings. Everything else was acceptable.

The service is on point, they were all super nice- always asking if I needed anything before I was even though with what they had given me.
author: Alvin L.

description:
I am torn between 3 stars or 4, and the breakdown comes down to this:
- Came to the restaurant on Friday around 7:00 pm with no reservations, a good 1/3 of seats empty. Worker asks if we have reservations, we didn't, so he said "Ok Ill check." We stood there as he went back to customers. Finally some other worker sits us down at the farthest table from the food. =( Since we were so far away from the cashier/main area the servers didn't really make eye contact with us throughout the night or come see if we needed anything as frequently as others.
- Food gave me a stomach ache =(
- Yay to good organization of vegetables you are able to grab them on your own from the serving station. Neat set-up. =)
- Food is average like your standard hotpot place. Not as many options as to others I have been to though in terms of meat. =/
author: Wendy L.

description:
AYCE $28 pp. Great service, great ambience & yummy food! I came here at around 7pm on a Friday night and the place wasn't full; but that shouldn't deter you from entering though! 

Our server was very attentive to our table and was willing to explain how to cook everything and recommended a lot of items to us. The service was just on point!! I think some servers don't really understand English though since my BF tried ordering another plate of meat and the server ended up calling another server to our table. If you speak canto or mandarin, the servers would be able to assist you also.

The soup bases I got was veg miso and the fiery beef. The server said the veg miso would bring out more of the flavor which I agree. The fiery beef base kind of over killed the original flavors of the food items. But if you like that extra kick, the soup base is for you. Anyway, I tried almost everything at the bar and all of the meat. I really liked the supreme beef and the rib eye the best out of all the meat selection & my fav sides were the clams, the ball w/ fish roe, and the mussels. 

The sauce bar is a really great idea IMO. Unlike little sheep, Fiery allows you to make your own sauce and it is to your liking of what and how much of the sauce you want to make (y'all should try the garlic+BBQ sauce+cilantro+green onion+chili sauce combo). I think what made me really enjoy my meal was the sauce!! 

There's also bottomless soda and they're served in cute mason jars.

I would def come here again in the future!!
author: Emily L.

description: This is strictly for waiting in line just to eat. Came in at 8pm and we waited for 30mins. So a party of two left and they did not clean the tables and we were still waiting. They prioritize the big group of party before anyone else. Poor customer service we were not greeted or told how much longer we had to wait. So we took our business elsewhere. I will not be back.
author: Curry S.

description:
Been coming here for Hot Pot because the other locations are too inconvenient due to parking; Hot Pot Garden still under construction for their 2nd year. 

The place service is pretty bad. Hiring people whom are raw, unable to even do the simplistic request like a clean plate or another pair of chop sticks. The 1st time coming they didn't even know the soda selection was down to Pepsi or Sprite only, only after walking back and forth of what wasn't available. When we got tea instead of soda, they never refilled.

Do not bring anyone who has food allergy here, they will kill them. The meats need to be requested like most other places. The vegetables and other cheaper stuff is pretty much self service. The sauces are self service and can see that a lot of the sauces has other things in them due to being so close together and how other customers are.

The tables are pretty tight together. We didn't have much room for the uncooked and cooked food on the table at the same time. There isn't enough room to put a purse of even a jacket when everyone is there. And sitting next to the door, there is often so many customers waiting that pretty much stand over your table, unable to even move unless they get out of your way. 

There is no WiFi available and reception is pretty bad in the back section. And they already add 18% to the total, so don't bother tipping.
author: M C.

description:
This used to be G Cube...and I'm so glad Fiery Hot Pot took over.

[+] Service was excellent! The owners are there and they were super nice. Staffs were super friendly.
[+] Ingredients tasted fresh
[+] Good choice of broth
[+] You can go get veges, noodles, seafood, sauce yourself so you can definitely have some portion control.
[+] PORK BLOOD tasted soooo good! It tasted like the ones back in Hong Kong. I'm definitely coming here for that!
[+] AC works! It feels comfortable inside AND they have TVs. I can watch football!
[+] They have a few small private rooms in the back
[+] AYCE includes soda and dessert 

[-] Small restaurant so there is a wait.
[-] Quality of the meat isn't super great but it is definitely do-able. Sometimes the meat comes out a little too frozen.
[-] Parking on Taraval can be hard. 
[-] Unlike Shabu House, they fill the soup with hot water, and not the soup base. They should really add the same soup base so the flavor doesn't go away.
author: Tammy F.

description: One of my favorite hot pot places, if not THE favorite at the moment.  Food is amazing, everyone who works there is super nice.  And the broths are soooooo good, that's like, the most important thing in a good hot pot right? With that said, the reason why I took one star of is because their overly complicated and unnecessary waiting system, people who aren't there yet are before the people who are already there, which literally always leaves a few tables empty while there is a long line of people waiting, I don't know what's going on in their head but that means less money for the house and more frustrated customers but hey...whatever is clever.   It doesn't stop me from going there because I love it so much but I chuckle every time I'm there waiting while looking at empty tables in front of me for like half hour at a time.  But yesss, once you've had their food you'll provably do the same thing lol.
author: Chi N.

description:
With the rise of all you can eat hotpot places in the Sunset and Richmond, this place is a standout. Great selection of meats, seafood, and veggies. Free soda and ice cream included. 

All you can drink beer and sake for $8 more. TVs throughout as well. What I particularly enjoyed was the attentive service and cleanliness of the place and the stocked sauce bar. You don't have you wait forever to get more meat. An instant favorite.
author: Dave C.

description:
Came on Presidents' Day for dinner. We had a reservation at 8, got seated a little past 8. 

Pros:
- Most of the stuff is self service, so it's convenient
- large variety of sides such as quail eggs, fish balls with roe, etc 
- sauce bar has lots of choices from ponzu, soy sauce, chopped jalapeños, cilantro, garlic, etc to more unique sauces such as bean curd sauce
- offer dessert at the end (choice between ice cream or grass jelly)

Cons:
- service was a little slow
- pork belly had a weird smell/ taste
- soup bases were kinda bland 
- way they bring out lamb and supreme beef was annoying as it was all clumped and meat broke apart 
- clams tasted funky and had a lot of sand 

Overall: not a bad place, but wouldn't come back. I'd rather go to iPot instead on Irving as their broths are tastier and they have more variety in meat choices. Our soup bases were rich pork broth and the spicy beef one. They were okay, nothing to really write joke about. I do really like how the vegetables and other stuff besides the raw meats are self service because there's no need to flag down wait staff or forgotten orders. The quality in the meats weren't terrible, but definitely nothing to write home about. The pork belly we ordered tasted really funky though. I almost waned to spit it out. Couldn't really figure out if it smelled weird, tasted weird, or both. Their sesame sauce tastes very oily and overpowers whatever you dip in it, instead of complimenting it. For dessert we were offered red bean ice cream or grass jelly, and we opted for the red bean ice cream. It was surprisingly good and creamy, without being too heavy on the dairy.
author: Sandy K.

description: This is my 2nd time here. And I just have to say this place is awesome! While most Hot Pot and Shabu places have bland broth, this place does not! Very Umami, you can taste the love that went into making the broth. The spicy beef broth is definitely fiery .  You order your broth selection and the type of meat you want with the waiter staff. Had the pork belly this time which is super thinly sliced and oh so yummy.  Other selections , are self serve and at the buffet bar.  They are all  in super cute containers.. just
author: l k.

description:
Not bad, but def not as good as iPot on Irving. I didn't care for the annoying customers hogging up the sauce station, or reaching over you to get stuff when you're clearly getting your stuff. Can I have some personal space here?! Guess they're clueless about invading personal bubbles.

Didn't like that we had small portions of meat and that we had to grab the waiter whenever we wanted more meat. Parking can be a bit of a pain but not too bad. We spent around the same as we did for iPot: $30 per person.
author: V M.

description: Our new go-to hot pot joint. Unlike the ones we have gone to in SF - this place is: self serve on everything but the meats, and it is clean, new inside, clean bathrooms, cheerful youthful staff that can't seemingly do enough for you and the various veggies and proteins are all presented in an attractive and thoughtful manner ! The quality of the beef and lamb and shrimps were quite good and the broths were also well made and adjusted to the degree of heat desired. For god sake they even throw in soft drinks and desert ?! Trust me - this is a VERY solid place, yummy and interesting options and if you don't want carb loading w wheat style noodles - they had a variety of veggie based noodles! Oh yes we will be back and we need to turn on our friends and two sons to this terrific hot pot spot ! Well done Fiery Hot Pot ! Thanks for your careful attention to detail and high quality and thoughtful presentation and ingredients !!! Except for that amazing Hot Pot I had in the Szechuan region of China (in a converted bomb shelter with some of my Chinese work colleagues) you are now my mainland fave ! Bravo. Keep it up and we will be back again and again !!!
author: alan c.

description:
My wife and I have been a regular customer of this place as we come here at least once a month since its opening.  It has always been a great experience, but the last 2 times we visited which happened just after the beginning of 2018, it was definitely not pleasing. 

Leo was one of the best waiter at this restaurant as he greeted customers very well, managed the restaurant in great efficiency and treated the restaurant like his own business; however, we were shocked to learn that he is no longer working here at our 1st visit in 2018, and both visits we had received definitely below average service from the waitresses.  We were not being greeted when we stepped into the restaurant; there was just an iPad at the entrance letting people to check in, and no one comes to the front to check regularly, and the waitresses pretty much ignore the how crowded it was at the entrance until they were finally able to manage their time to come forward.

My last visit was just 3 nights ago, and the wait time was seriously ridiculous. I called the restaurant for reservation, and they told me to sign in via yelp, which we did, and it says about 30-45mins wait. That's fine as we were just almost on the way to get there. Around 30mins later, we arrived the restaurant and noticed the wait position hasn't changed (we were the 5th one) but we started seeing people leaving, so good sign. However, there were a total of 5 waitresses who only focus on cleaning, taking empty container and taking existing customers' orders. They didn't seat anyone party in until there were 3~4 tables emptied for at least 10mins. We became the next party to be seated after 20ish mins and saw another table just left, so we thought we are gonna be seated soon, but what happened? We actually waited another 30-40mins at the entrance until being seated as they just cleaned the table and did something else without coming to the front to check people in. By the time we got seated, there were a total of 4 tables emptied, and at least 3 parties left at the entrance due to the long wait and inefficiency. And when we got called, the waitresses did not even say a word on the long wait time but just started taking our orders.  Seriously, we did not really feel welcoming anymore in this restaurant which such greatly deteriorated service.

They introduced wagyu at our 1st 2018 visit, and they cut it so thin to a point my wife didn't even notice she ate it when she had the 1st piece.  The 2nd time was better cut, and the rest of the food pretty much still remain the same standard.

Overall, I think it's such a shame to see this restaurant which has great food and portion to start going downwards due to its deterioration in service. We missed the time when Leo was still there as we enjoyed so much on both service and food. We will most likely get there again maybe next month, and i guess it will be our last visit if the service and efficient have not been improved.  

The only reason I'm not giving 1-star is because the food still taste ok.
author: Henry M.

description: The selection was very good and the servers were very nice and attentive. Didnt have to wait too long in the cold either! Will be back!
author: Jason T.

description:
For another hot pot place in the city, it distinguishes itself by having ingredients buffet style. Going in, I worried about the buffet area being gross, messy, and dirty. It surprised me. They kept it very clean, and the portions for each item is reasonable: not too much, not too little. 

They have a handful of different types of broths. We got the spicy one and the pork. If you don't like szechuan peppers, you won't like the soup since it has the numbing effect that comes with the peppers. The pork was pretty delicious as well, not spicy. 

You order the meats at the table through the servers. The servers don't all speak english well... you can tell when they look at your blankly when you ask for something simple like water. But there are two servers that come by often and are super attentive. 

I enjoyed being able to control the portions of items. Usually, for hot pot you order from an ayce menu, you don't necessarily want a huge amount of a specific item and then there are items, you want double or triple orders of... this place allows you to chose per your liking. 

I'll be coming back. The restaurant is small, so either get reservations or come early. Another perk is that parking isn't so bad around this neighborhood.
author: Jeannie L.

description: Wow. The food is great, the service is awesome and the vibe is just phenomenal. Will definitely recommend this to other people
author: Jm D.

description:
The restaurant setting is good.
Lots meat and vegetables to choose from. 
Out of the many dishes we chose, there are tofu, corn, mushroom, shrimp, fishball.., not fresh at all. 
The broth were too salty. 
Meat looked aged, been defrost many times.  
Service was slow, it took at already 15 mins to serve.
Hot plate was not functioning.
The buffet table should be at lower temperature, like salad bar table. 
We expected much better quality with this price. 
Worst of all, desert fruit was spoiled. 
Hope it would improve, or it will close soon.
author: K.C. T.

description: Great service, tasty broths, everything looked fresh and the restaurant was very clean.  Great value, would definitely go back.
author: Daniel D.

description:
This ayce hotpot place is pretty bomb. The only con I have about this place is how they made my party of 3 wait for a table after 8pm when they close at 10 and do last call at 9:30. We had another person coming, but they should've seated us when it wasn't even busy. 

Anyways, I love the decor of this place. It's very modern and sleek in my opinion. There's plenty of tvs around the restaurant, so it's perfect for the upcoming warrior games! 

Ayce $28, includes soft drinks! $8 more for aycd, which includes draft beer and cold or hot sake. One more con, all parties have to do aycd in the table if one person does it. $8 is such a great price but one of our friends didn't drink alcohol at all! I kind of wish they would have made an exception, especially if the person does not even drink! Oh well, rules are rules. 

In the back, you get to choose your assortment of veggies and you can also make your own sauces. I like how they have fish ball with roe, lobster balls, imitation crab sticks, cooked clams, mussels, shrimp, various mushrooms, ramen, udon, and napa that's already cut. Some of the balls were still frozen, but the veggies were good quality. The sauces vary from soy sauce, hoisin, chili sauce, BBQ sauce, ponzu, garlic, green onions, jalepenoes, and cilantro. I put together BBQ sauce (almost like satay consistency), soy sauce, chili sauce, green onions, and jalepenoes- it turned out a little sour. But I was too lazy to make another one and fail, so I stuck to it lol. The meats include ribeye, supreme beef, chicken breast, lamb/pork shoulder, pork belly, and pigs blood!! The meats were good quality too and I love how they have pig blood! Yum. 

The service is actually really good and attentive. It was not busy anymore and the two guy servers did a good job on serving us. They were professional, yet friendly and personable. Never rude and seemed happy to help us. Definite plus from an Asian establishment! 

I will be back whenever I have hotpot cravings!
author: Brenda K.

description: BEST SERVICE AND HIGH QUALITY FOOD! I'm very picky with the the flavor of my broth. I ordered the Vegetarian Spicy Miso and request it to be extra spicy and my boyfriend ordered the Spicy Pork broth. The broth was so flavorful! One of our favorite part is the self serve side dish area. Adults are charged $28.99 but the price includes soft drinks with free refills and dessert. I believe children 3 years old and under eat for free and child under the age of 10 year olds are charged $13.99. You don't have to flag your server down for refills, more meat, or for any other request because they pay close attention to their customers. This restaurant is very clean. Shabuway on Geary Blvd used to be our go to place, but now Fiery is our first option and Shabuway will be our second option. Also take into consideration that although they close at 11:00 pm, they do stop seating customer by 10:00 pm. They do this for your own good. This doesn't benefit them. If you're paying close to $30 for a all you can eat dinner, you most likely want to be able to dine in without feeling rush.
author: Jennifer L.

description: It really frustrates me when an establishment doesn't honor their business hours. I understand last calls and such but to say you're closed an hour before you're supposed to be is kind of ridiculous. I'll update this review if I ever come back to try this place. Be warned, business hours say they close at 11 but they won't seat/serve you past 10.
author: Kimmy N.

description:
went with my friends. we were satisfied! 
great food and excellent service! we'll definitely come back! sobrang sarap!
author: Gorgeena W.

description: Good hot pot place. Relatively small, good customer service except the tall man, he was really stingee on giving out more beef. I like the sauce bar and being able to pick my own hot pot items was cool. Wished they had a all you can eat sobert/ice cream bar... cause I will be all up on that lychee sobert. So bomb. Can't wait to go again
author: Ann L.

description: Great service! Self-service on the side dishes, which is awesome. You can order as much meat as you want at once, of course, with the intention that you'll be able to finish it all. There's a good selection and the broth is very flavorful too.
author: Tina R.

description:
Really decent hot pot experience.  The service was warm and attentive.  Everything was really fresh. The sauces were helpful because the broth tend to be more on the bland side, which is good because it's not overly salty. We got both the rich roast beef broth and the spicy beef broth. 
More expensive than other hot pot places because it's all you can eat.
author: N T.

description: Called a week ahead of time to make a reservation for 8 on a Saturday and was seated promptly once everyone arrived. SO glad I made the reservation because there seems to be a long wait!! This is a pretty simple hot pot buffet, you order your soup base and meats with the server and the buffet line offers everything else from the soy sauce and toppings to vegetables and carbs. I like that everything was in small individual bowls so you aren't grabbing from a big pile which can be messy when it gets busy. Also it helps with portion control, so people aren't getting more than they can eat! Service was great, the meat was good however I couldn't really tell the difference between their supreme and rib eye... and they weren't consistent because our first order was very lean and the second order of the same beef was really fatty. Regardless, everything was tasty and fresh and I will be coming back!!
author: Athena L.

description: White person here. Fiery is the bomb. Great flavors, great meat, great sauce, great service, clean and nice decor, good price.
author: Jim S.

description: Overall, everything was great. The food, the service, the presentation, it was all great. The only thing that annoyed me was the wait. I was pretty hungry that day and waiting half an hr to be seated got me impatient but the wait was worth it m, I guess :3
author: Dolly J.

description:
So happy a new hot pot place opened up. Make reservations because it does get super busy. Soup needs a little bit of work. I did half and half, one was pork bone I think and the other one was spicy....too spicy for me. The place is clean and I like how they have a buffet station where you can grab the food you want. It's also not too much in each plate/bowl so you aren't wasting or overwhelmed. The sauce bar is awesome. 

The meat you have to order with the waiter, but they are pretty fast. There is a little bit of a language barrier, but they understand enough. They also cleaned up our empty plates/bowls a good amount. I forgot the price, but I think it's $25 a person. 

I will be back!
author: Karen H.

description: My fav hot pot in town! Recommend for vegetarian as well! Well service and clean. Variety vegetables and meats to choose.
author: Ting H.

description: Wonderful place with high quality of meats and sauce bar just like Taiwan's hot pot restaurant, and the broth is so amazing! Should definitely give this place a try!
author: Léa Y.

description: There's not much I can say but, damn this place is Good! Very fresh tasty meat. Talk about premium grade meat. The broth was omg bomb good. And seriously the best part is, they broke the stereo type of Asian restaurants, normal Asian restaurants are rude but they're so kind and fast I didn't need to ask for a refill or anything they served us with 5 star service.
author: James T.

description: Wow an amazing place. Everything was so cool. Hot pot that can hold 2 different broths to accommodate my future vegetarian hubby and the spicy meat lover me. Meats and veggies were super fresh and beautifully displayed. And the stuffed fish ball that explodes fish roe. So good, I'm drooling right now just thinking about it. So impressed that I'm gonna have my family wedding dinner here. Whole restaurant holds 60 people and hot pot for 90 mins is less than $30/ person. All you can drink beer/ sake is $8/person. What a deal and man was I full afterwards. Service was great until it got super busy. So best to go when they first open at 5 pm. They have TVs playing k-pop and top 40 music videos too. So you will be eating, drinking, and listening to Korean rap, which is a good time in my books. Check it out.
author: Janice F.

description: Good variety of meat, love the sauce bar, servers were efficient and fast for a busy ass night and can't argue with the bottomless soda! AND you can reserve a table online which is pretty damn convenient for a hotpot place! Cheers to my first review for ya'll! Gonna come here more often :) only con is the tight spaces but overall 5/5
author: Chelly G.

description: Not much choice for beef but the place looked clean n I like the way they display the food so it won't be a waste of food just get what u want ... they kids enjoyed it
author: Nancy W.

description: Omg!!!! Definitely a must try if you haven't already! Love the place it's a whole in the wall! You walk in a me get greeted right away! Staff is super friendly you gotta love that very attentive! It's buffet style as far as the veggies, sauces, and seafood goes! Endless fountain drinks! If your coming here bring your appetite! You are sure to leave pleased and with a very satisfied tummy! Definitely better than Shabu! I will definitely be returning!
author: Roxana J.

description: I HAD to try a hot pot buffet! It was literally where you go up to a buffet and get your food. New York has all you can eat hot pots, but not a bar where you can get your own food. The food was really fresh and they give you 90 minutes to eat and go. The broth was also very flavorful, I got the fiery beef one and the vegetarian miso. The price wasn't bad. It was 28.99 and it includes soda and dessert. You can also add $8 and get unlimited alcohol too. The area is decent and the restaurant is big. Servers were really attentive and friendly. Would come back again!!
author: Irene Z.

description: Awesome hot pot buffet! I was sad G Cube closed but Fiery is so awesome and a great replacement. Tons of options at the buffet. My favorites are the shrimp and noodles. A lot of sauce options to choose from. Great beef, lamb, and house made dumplings. All you can eat plus all you can drink for an additional $7. My friends and I loved it so much we are coming back for my birthday celebration next weekend!
author: A S.

description: Superb customer service, great value, great quality of ingredients. But ultimately the service blanketed the entire experience to be special! Will definitely come back!
author: Sylvia K.

description: This place was awesome.  All you can eat hot pot sounds amazing and it is lol.  I like how you can pick all the sides you'd like to go in.  Then you just keep getting waves of your choice of meats.  They have spicy if you like a' spicy haha. My girlfriend and I found this little gem on a random foodie stop in SF
author: Anthony P.

description: What a pleasant surprise! A great selection of food, all of great quality, and beautifully placed. The restaurant is very clean, and the service was friendly and very attentive. I will definitely be recommending this restaurant to my friends, and plan to come back soon!
author: Brenda T.

description: As a recent hot pot convert, can I just say that Fiery hits ALL the high points?!  Split pot, all you can eat, all types of meat, the veggies are displayed beautifully in small portions and buffet-style. Also, cleanliness. So clean. The only annoying thing is the location. Otherwise, highly recommend for a small-ish group, maybe 4 people would be perfect for this.
author: Lydia W.

description:
Used to come here a lot when it was GCube- Good food, spacious, not stuffy, good location. We were pleasantly surprised with the new tenants 
Its not too spicy, as the name might make you think. 
We got tip top service when we went. ( We were the only table ). 
The great part about this place is that there is a buffet table of everything (non-protein) you want. So you don't have to wait for the wait staff to come help you for just another serving of tofu. This is definitely a good spot.
author: Ping N.

description: HUGE fan of hot pot here! I have to say that I love their system where I can pick what I want when I want it.... Have already been back 3 times.
author: Susi L.

description:
Would love this place if they worked on their broth. Broth is everything for hot pot. It can make or break your experience and the broth here was just too heavy for my liking. My family and I got the rich pork broth, tasted like there was some curry in there. 

What I did like about this place is the service, our server was very friendly. Checked up on us often to make sure everything was good. The food here is good, I like how they are very organized and neat. HUGE plus. The food items I really enjoyed were like fish balls with roe, yam noodles, all their veggies and quail eggs!
author: cadence p.

description: Good variety of broths and fresh veggies. Can't speak for the meats as we're both vegetarian. Service is prompt and attentive -- sometimes overly so. This place would have gotten 4 stars except that we were blind sided by a $75 bill for two people. Watch out for buffet pricing I guess.
author: L M.

description:
Service is attentive, unlike other hot pot spots. Everyone there was very nice. Veggie election was okay, they did not have tong ho when we were there :(
Overall, delicious and will be back!
author: Ana P.

description: So yummy! The rib eye and the lamb were so delicious. And it is a buffet style, with a classier vibe. We (my boyfriend and i) went on a Monday night and we were the only people there! Skeptical.. a little. But we were greeted, sat down quickly, explained the menu, and then free to grab all the condiments, sauces, we liked! They had a sauce bar, a bunch of different veggie options, and the shrimp cooked in the broth was delicious! i bet it gets crackin there on the weekend because the food is all you can eat for less than $30, and all you can drink for an additional $8. We just had one beer (3$ each) and felt totally worth it. The broth was spicy-we did half spicy beef and half miso. And they didn't skimp on the entree refills. They just kept bringing us full plates. I have had a lot of hot pot in the city, and this by far is my favorite. i DEFINITELY recommend.
author: Julie H.

description: Been here twice, not bad hotpot. Good experience both times, clean and meats are decent quality as well as the sides :)
author: Barry H.

description: This place is amazing, yes, its hot pot, but the food, the service, is amazing. The owners are very nice and the quality of the meats, the freshness of the veggies and the variety of the veggies are amazing. The price includes all you can eat meats, sodas, and dessert, other hot pot places will charged for drinks. If you go with a party that loves to drink, for 10.00 per person-the whole party has to get the charge per person, its all you can drink beer and sake, but you can also get beer, sake, soju cocktails by the bottle and by the pitcher, and their price for bottle or pitcher of beer and sake is very reasonable. I love this place, I told my sister and cousin and they came last week and loved it to. Its good for groups too, everyone can eat whatever they want, when it's time to split the bill, everyone knows how much they have to pay.
author: Howie C.

description: Amazing service. Seafood, vegetables, noodles are in small bowls you can grab when needed. Only thing you need to order is the red and chicken meats. This makes service really fast. And Because vegetables are in portions, you don't have to wait for people to spend time spooning their portions on plates. Really great concept, fresh ingredients, delicious soup. Decent price. Highly recommend. Can clearly see there is passion involved to make this place great.
author: Ken T.

description: Decided to give this place a try since I heard so much good things about it. Called in to make a reservation for 5 people on the day of and they said they only take reservations the day before (which was fine). We got there around 6:30pm, but it was jammed packed. There were a lot of tables open but looked like they were all reserved. We waited over 1 hr and to find out we couldn't sit together, but had to split up. By this time, we didn't care anymore and just wanted to eat. I liked the idea it was a buffet style and the food setup was well organized. The soup based was really delicious! We had the Rich Pork Beef (very flavorful) and the Firey Curry (it was spicy!). Overall, everything was super tasty and will definitely come again. Highly recommend to make reservations!
author: Deanna T.

description: Not bad, just overpriced. Their servings are tiny and they don't have many seafood options. As a pescatarian, that's a big one for me. I prefer Grand Hot Pot Lounge on Geary over this place. It's less expensive and they have more variety. Plus, it's bigger and the atmosphere is more fun.
author: Isaiah G.

description: Very good Hot Pot buffet, I have experience. Service was good, we had a very large party of 25 guest and they made sure to keep our reservation time as promised. The selection of meats are well presented and side dishes were excellent.
author: Gordon P.

description: Extremely yummy broth, efficient self-service, fresh high quality meat - what more could a hotpot lover ask for?
author: Huan L.

description:
this place used to be g-cube shabu.. it's under new ownership and became a hot pot buffet

my friend found this place so we decided to check it out and be the guinea pigs before our group dinner

$28 ayce +$8 if you want aycd as well
unlimited soda and tea is inlcuded

picked veggie miso and fiery spicy beef as our broth
we got almost all the meat options and the housemade dumplings
the meat quality is ok, could be better
housemade dumplings are a surprise, its shrimp and corn

the buffet is cool. take your pick of mushrooms, green veggies, tofu, seafood, etc. I liked their sauce bar. 

end your meal with dessert. i got lychee sorbet. i never had lychee sorbet before and loved it.. it was like those lychee jellies you'd buy from the asian market 

service was great, leo was nice..everything was pretty good during our meal so why the low rating? once we got home, we got intense headaches and came to the conclusion that they must use msg! i even had a headache the next day.. if it wasn't for that, we would come back.
author: Raquel T.

description: So I have had a good share of hot pot places in the bay area, and I think this place could be up there. Here are the pros: AMAZING SERVICE, good variety, THE PRESENTATION, clean, quality meat, and your choice of sauces. Cons: Broth is not flavourful :( I mean, there are different soup bases but they really dont have any flavour so you cant enjoy your food without sauce. For me I really think broth is an important aspect in hot pot, so thats why I rated it so low. But again, if you are a hot pot lover this is a place you should try =D
author: Jasmina D.

description: It's okay and for what you get, it's a bit expensive. Those fish cakes, imitation crabs can be cheaply bought at chinese market (preservatives kind of food). I found it nothing special, although the roast beef broth is pretty good. Meat quality is fine, a bit on the thicker side. I still preferred Japanese shabu shabu better. More of neighborhood type of restaurant. It wasn't full of people when we went there. Veggies are fresh, no yellow leaves, which is good. Service is fine. I don't think I will go back.
author: Clemencia S.

description:
This place is so great! After a HORRIBLE experience at iPot I wanted to find a better location for my AYCE hot pot cravings.

Food: They have several options for meat. The ribeye is my favorite. A very CLEAN and well stocked self service sauce bar and sides bar. Some of my favorites were the shrimp balls, quail eggs, plethora of veggies, noodle options, clams, and many others! They carry most items other AYCE hot pot places have. 

Customer Service: AMAZING! This is where Fiery Hot Pot really shines out. The service is the BEST i've had in any other AYCE location I've ever been to. Everyone is smiling, polite, and extremely attentive. I not once had to wave anyone down for a drink refill, soup refill, or to put in my order. Dirty empty dishes are taken away right away and the entire staff seems happy to be working there. Being served by a happy and polite staff really just puts the icing on the cake for me when it comes to dining out. 

Funny story - my boyfriend and I were bickering about something at the table, and the server came by to check on us and ask how everything was going. After he left, we couldn't stop gushing about how good the service was here we forgot we were even bickering in the first place! 

Price: $27.99/person with soda and dessert included

Accessibility: Parking is pretty easy in this neighborhood. First time I came around 6pm on a Saturday and there was no wait, but there were a few parties waiting by 7pm. Went again yesterday on a rainy Friday night at 8:30pm and only waited 5 minutes or so. 

Fiery is and will continue to be my go to place for hot pot in the city thanks to the stellar service :)
author: Sam T.

description: Really good service.  They check on your at exact intervals.  Love how this place includes free drink in their cute mason jars.  They also have all you can drink alcohol option for an additional fee.  Very clean.  Meat was great and fresh.  However, the side items that you can pick up on your own such as the meatballs were not so fresh.  They were frozen and maybe a bit old?? Broth was yummy.
author: Jiji K.

description: I'm a fan of Hot Pots and this is one of my fav.  I came here on 3 different occasions with less than a 15 minute wait each time.  They have a nice self service stationwhich you can go up and grab your own veggies, noodles, and seafoood.  Only the meat they will bring to your table.  Everything is fresh. It's $28 for all you can eat which I got my $$ worth.
author: Roadrunner G.
