description: This place is great! Make a reservation though. My bf and I just walked in, waited a couple minutes then got seated, but we were lucky, really lucky. Other than that the place is wonderful and really great service.
author: Kaitlin V.

description:
Came here on a Friday night so I was pretty anxious about having to wait for a table but we got seated right when we walked in! We were greeted right away and was asked if we had reservations so I'm guessing you can make one for all my fellow impatient people! 

I wouldnt say they have a large selection but everything was super fresh. They offer 6 types of meat; supreme beef, ribeye, pork shoulder, pork belly, lamb shoulder and chicken breast. Their fish is a muuuuust! Not only was it fresh but they add a little bit of ginger on top for that extra kick! Amazing! Besides the meat and fish, everything else was self served. I must say their choices are pretty on point... They have rice cakes, fish tofu, shrimp, fish ball with roe, mussels etc... All the hot pot essentials you would get if you were to make hot pot at home haha oh! Soda and dessert is also included! All you can drink beer and sake for $8 more. 

Their service was the cherry on top. EVERY SINGLE SERVER HAD A SMILE ON THEIR FACE. I honestly think the rarest things you can find in a Chinese restaurant are nice and attentive servers and clean bathrooms lol We sat by the entrance so I was able to see how each customer was greeted.. Literally everyone was welcomed in with a big smile and kindly asked how many people they had. Servers were constantly walking back and forth collecting finished plates and they checked in with is pretty often as well. 

Not sure how much it is for lunch but for dinner, it's $29 per person $30.50 after tax. Give this place a try if you're ever craving for hot pot!
author: P L.

description: Came here on a Thursday night with reservations for 6. We got seated right away and helped ourselves to creating our own sauces for dipping. The sauce station had a variety of sauces and toppings for your dipping pleasures. I had a mix of soy sauce, ponzu, seas and, cilantro, scallions, lots of garlic, and chili sauce. If you want a raw egg to mix with your sauce you need to request from one of the waiters. We got to choose two soup based since they do halves without additional cost. My friend and I opted in for spicy fiery beef and rich pork broth. Since my other friends eat lamb we had our own pot next to them to keep that lamb taste from our soup aha. I requested for really mild fiery spicy beef broth but it was actually pretty spicy so I didn't use that side as much as the rich pork broth, which you can never go wrong with when you go to hot pot/shabu spots. All the meats and seafood would need to be to be requested from the waiters, but they have a veggie station where you help yourself go veggies, noodles, etc. The large clear noodles were a hit with my friends and the fish filet. I stuck to my usual ribeye and premium beef, which were a cut a little thicker than I like but they tasted good. Your all-you-can-eat meal comes with complimentary soda so I ordered the Minute Maid lemonade since I'm not a huge fan of the other soda options; unlimited refills! After our meal we had the option for complimentary desserts: lychee ice cream or grass jelly with canned fruits. We liked the lychee ice cream because it reminded us of the jelly cups markets use to sell. The grass jelly was a bit bland and the fruits weren't sweet. Overall paid $48 per person since we paid for birthday girl too. Not a bad spot, but good timing since Hot Pot Garden is still renovating.
author: Amanda C.

description: Woo hoo! I'm the 100th reviewer! We came here on a Friday night at 7pm and luckily we snagged a spot right away. Parking may or may not be difficult here, depends on the timing. We were seated right away and for our soup base we chose the spicy beef which was very spicy considering it to be mild and the pork broth. I love how you get free soda if you decide to do AYCE. The limit was 90 minute and that's totally fine. It was our first time here and the server explained to us how it works. There's a sauce bar where you can mix your own sauce and besides meat and soda refills. You can basically go to the buffet and grab whatever you want ranging from noodles,seafood, and vegetables. I like the concept of this place because you don't have to call your waiter every time you need something. Overall the food here is okay but what makes this place is the customer service! Every time we finish a plate of food they just automatically take it away without you asking. P.s our bill total was about 60$ and they also have ice cream for dessert!
author: Tina C.

description: Xmas eve dinner and they were able to handle our party of 12.  This place has a nice set-up - they bring you whatever meats you want, while you take care of self-serving all of the extras.  They put all the extras into small containers, which keeps the self-serve area pretty clean.  Plenty of wait staff to pick up your dishes.  They have a 90-minute limit, but if you stay focused on cooking and eating, that will be plenty of time.
author: Glenn L.

description: Came here last minute with the husband and a friend. We were very pleasantly surprised with the customer service, along with the food quality. Normally, when we think of All You Can Eat Buffets, you think of mass quantity, poor quality goods. This place had their veggies washed and chopped perfectly, meats came out clean and lean, as we as service being spot on. We did not walk out feeling bloated compared to some other hotpot places in the area. We'd come back!
author: Tracy C.

description: Great new place!  It included all you can eat hot pot for 90 minutes.  There wasn't a line when I got there.  They let you have two types of broth and both were delicious.  You can go up to the buffet station when you can select various types of vegetables and sauces.  The quality of the vegetables is great.  Soda and dessert is also included.
author: Hannah T.

description: They said it would be at most a 30 minute wait.  It has been over an hour, and I am still waiting here with my family.  There is nothing unbelievable about this place, and it is not worth the wait for what you get.  Avoid at peak hours.
author: Misa C.

description: Finally got the chance to try this hot pot buffet last weekend! I made reservation for Sunday and when I got to the restaurant they told me they accidentally put the reservation down for Saturday, but they were very nice to quickly give us a table anyways. They sat us in the room at the back and I was a bit wary thinking we will have a hard time getting the server's attention to order, but they were super attentive and kept checking up on us for any orders,. The refrigerated cold bar and sauce bar was very convenient and clean. They always quickly restock the food when it's low. The down part about this place is that I think they use MSG in their soup, which is typical but it got me so thirsty for the rest of the night after dinner. They also lack variety in their soup, meat, and food selection compared to other restaurants alike. Nonetheless, it's still a nice restaurant to eat it on a foggy day in SF !
author: Lucy C.

description: The quality of the meat at this place is fantastic. The selection of ingredients to add to your broth is great, too. But what really sets this place apart is the service. Rarely, if ever, do I leave a restaurant thinking "man, that waiter was incredible." At a hot pot or shabu place, the waiter is important and our guy (the tallest guy) was just fantastic. All the hot pot I can eat plus unlimited sodas and great service for 27.99 is a steal!
author: Erik S.

description: I have gone there to eat numerous of time. The workers are friendly n quick service. The selections of soups base from spicy to non spicy n many varieties of sauces to choose from, the of veggies n sea foods  plus more all laid out for you to pickup n go; beefs r very tender if u don't over cook in the soup; I think overall the foods are very simple....drink n dessert included.  Will return for more hot pot in the future.
author: Ms R.

description: Great hot pot place! The staff is friendly. The food is high quality. I would highly recommend going to this place for great Chinese hot pot food. I will definitely be back again.
author: Iya J.

description: The service here is amazing. The team is super responsive and not like other hot pot places where you have to wait ages for someone to notice you and bring you more meat. What makes me give Fiery Hot Pot only two stars is the quality of the broth. We tried both the pork and beef broth. The pork broth tasted metallic not unlike the taste of something from a can. The beef broth was unmemorable. The meat selection is just ok but the sides and condiments are vast and set up in an easy to use way. If we could have waitstaff at any other hot pot restaurant I'd be elated. Another important thing to note is that the floor here is extremely slippery. Like someone is going to fall and break their neck slippery.
author: ipvcake i.

description: Staff are super nice and friendly. The meat quality is good! But the veggie section does not have plenty of options. In general the place is near and nice. Like this place e a lot!
author: Ck R.

description: Staff was ok but the service was very friendly. They are very attentive to everyone. Food was very yummy!
author: Doll L.

description: Terrible customer service. I didn't even eat, waited forever with no acknowledgment until I finally decided to leave. Food smelled good though. Will not be returning.
author: Brianna T.

description: This is a pretty decent hot pot place but their service needs some improvement. I ordered meat but they apparently forgot about my order and took them quite a while. Their pot for hot pot is quite small and anyone getting food from the pot must be careful to not spill onto the portable stove because it will turn off the stove. They have a section for people to get veggies, mushrooms, noodles, and dressings etc so that's very convenient.
author: Angel N.

description: Delicious hot pot, love the fact that you can see the different mini dishes before having to order them, the buffet system is total genius. Will have to make it out here again.
author: A K.

description:
Great ambiance and excellent service! I love the contemporary touch and the cleanliness.
Leo and the service staff are filled with energy and big contagious smiles. The best hotpot place I've been to thus far in the city. A must try!
author: Lily L.

description: The broth is not good. The food has a sour taste. This place would rather put a college football game on than Giants playoff baseball.  Never going to return.
author: Kevin L.

description: Buffet style hot pot. Super nice staff! Super delicious! Price is good! Tons of choice! I love the watermelon dessert! Highly recommended this new hot pot place!
author: Rain H.

description: Nothing organized here! We were waiting for so long, and then some one just took our spot for no reason . Very bad experience!
author: Bella C.

description:
We checked out this place after reading Yelp and were not disappointed.  Service was excellent and the food delicious.  Thought the quality of the meat was outstanding and the broth very flavorful.  We were surprised and delighted by the ACYD sake as our expectations were low thinking it would be not very high quality due to the price and yet it was fantastic.  We had 4 large carafes :)

The buffet was well stocked and really clean.  Nice offerings especially the mushroom selection which is my favorite.  We would have liked a few more options on the sauce bar compared to a few other locations in the area.

Overall the service was outstanding.  They were attentive, friendly and they all seemed quite happy to be there.  The food was delicious and high quality.  Don't forget to get the pineapple coconut ice cream for dessert.  The atmosphere was warm and exceptionally clean.  Would absolutely return!
author: Katia D.

description: Fantastic service, delicious food, great selection and a fair price. Was very happy with our meal! The Pork Belly was my favorite.
author: Joey K.

description: Very fresh ingredients, extremely friendly service.  The homemade dumplings (wontons) were especially delicious, and the beef broth was the best hot pot broth I've tasted.  The soda included in the AYCE was an additional plus.
author: Robert L.

description: Wow, my daughter suggested Fiery for dinner last night and I'm so glad she did!!!  I had never had hot pot before, and it turned out to be a wonderful experience.  The staff was so friendly and helpful.  They explained how to pick from the menu, what tastes best with what and how to pick out the side dishes and cooking instructions.  What fun and great food.  I was so full I couldn't even think about having dessert, which comes with the meal.  Looking forward to enjoying Fiery again.   Thank you for the wonderful time!!
author: Jacque J.

description: I decided to come in here on a leap of faith . I had originally wanted to come to this neighborhood for this Shanghai style dumpling place but I came across this hot pot place after I parked outside . I decided it could be fun to visit this place instead since I was already parked outside . I walked inside and it was really clean, modern, and welcoming. It's only $27 AYCE and that includes soda and the side dishes station. The wait staff was really friendly, attentive, fast, and helpful in describing to me how the menu works. The menu basically is comprised of about 6 different types of meat, soju, beer, and drinks. There's a self-serving buffet station filled with all types of sauces, udon, rice noodles, spam, tofu, yam, fish balls, quail eggs, and some other items I forgot to mention. You can boil the meats and side items in the boiler in your table. And the boiler has 2 different compartments so you can use 2 different soup bases. The mango jelly dessert was scrumptious! You can ask for white rice and I found that they delivered my rice fast and I have about 4 refills this night . Overall I am very pleased with the ambience, service, food, and the impressive selections. I will be back! Bravo to this new hot pot restuarant !
author: Stephen C.

description: My family and I went on Sunday night without reservations. I was greeted at the door and was sat down in few minutes after! Our waiter came explained to us our options and gave us some suggestions. After we reviewed the menu we settled for the spicy broth and split it with the rich pork broth. We also decided on Ribeye, pork belly, fish, and home made dumplings. Every thing was delicious! The veggies were fresh and right portions. I would definitely come back!
author: Susana Q.

description: We love hot pot and what it really nice about Fiery is that the veggies, noodles and dumplings are served buffet style so you can pick what you want when you want it. The meat and fish are good and the servers check in a few times to see if you need any more. It gets pretty crowded so it is good to call ahead.
author: Dawn S.

description: Great selection of meats, seafood, and vegetables!  Fresh, delicate, and well stocked.  Very popular so make your reservation if coming with a larger group.  Will definitely go back there again.
author: Esther M.

description: The food was mediocre at best. They lack variety compared to other hot pot places. The menu is very misleading... Waitress lied to us and said tea drinks were included in AYCE, but stuck us with a 40 dollar surcharge for some herbal tea for 5 people and some plum juice. She admitted to the mistake and still made us pay..customers never right I guess :/
author: Diana L.

description: This is an excellent spot for hot pot in the Sunset area. I like their options for soup base. I tried half beef soup and half vegetarian miso soup - equally delicious. Their ribeye beef was also very tender. They also offer a variety of sauces and side dishes at the bar. Their staff were friendly and helpful. Overall, it was a great experience. Would definitely go back again!
author: Sean D.

description: New hotpot spot in sunset area...  The meats are fresh and the broth has excellent favor...  Will be coming for a while..
author: Daniel L.
